RAW: The consequences of my drug addiction left me alone, often institutionalized, and abandoned from those I loved. No one wanted to be around me, and sometimes, I just didn’t want to be around anyone either, often isolating myself. I remember the pain of this isolation when my desire to use creeps back in. The books tell me how degraded I felt, how alone I felt. But what I remember more than anything else, is my lack of excitement for life. Today, I am energized to work, to learn, and to feel again. When using, my favorite part of the day was going to sleep. Today, it’s when I wake up.
CATS: WORTHINESS / connections & sharing,PROGRESS / future & hope,GROWTH / learning & mistakes,CHANGE / motivations
WELLGOS: Pain Abstainer,Isolation SOS’r,The Dynamotivator,Killer Kickstarter

RAW: I spent all of my money using, and often, other people’s money. In recovery, I actually have money saved----something I didn’t think was possible. The way I feel about myself, my confidence, has grown tremendously since sobriety. Having something to show for it, a little bit of cash in my wallet--- gets me excited for my future. What I thought was impossible, is becoming possible. My time using was wasted time. My time is a gift. I choose to stay grateful for that gift, and use my time in fulfilling ways.
CATS: BENEFITS / COSTS,CONFIDENCE /  hope & future,SOBRIETY / behavior & action,INNER / SELF / beliefs & insight
WELLGOS: Missi-Un-Impossiblizer ,The Benefisher,Gratitude Gardener,The Hopenotizer,Self Esteem Elixir,I-Can-ographer

RAW: On social media, I see my “normal” friends going out and partying. Sometimes I think I’m missing something. Cravings will come back in those moments---the taste and smell of painkillers and heroin, and the ritualistic experience before I used. Even the taste of Jack Daniels---the first feeling of warmth, and of being buzzed would creep in. But I focus on staying clean just for that day, sometimes just for an hour, and the cravings pass. After a certain point in addiction, my mind couldn’t tell the difference between cravings and a perpetual need to use. When I got clean, noticeable cravings would creep in, but they would pass. My desire to stay clean has become stronger than my desire to use. Cravings attack. I attack back. With meetings, and building a network, I become stronger than the cravings.
CATS: COMMUNITY / Meetings & groups,INNER POWER / Self control & willpower,CRAVINGS / will power & tools
WELLGOS: Craverade,New Pattern Painter / grit & progress,Pattern Interrupter,Inner Trash Trasher,Urge X’r

RAW: Cravings can get really bad on some days. Some days, I obsess over just the excitement I used to feel before I picked up. But I have more power than I think I do. I don’t have to use just because I have a craving. When I have a craving, I can call my sponsor before I decide to use. I simplify it that much. I have faith that I am being taken care of. I do not need to be religious to know this. I was in the deepest, darkest depression while using, and managed to get out of it, safely. The universe wants me here, and that knowledge helps to control my cravings.
CATS: CRAVINGS / support & help,FAITH,WARNINGS / Relapse & tools,HIGHER POWER / surrender
WELLGOS: Faith Flooder,Grace Moonlighter,Gratitude Guru,SELF HARM / Warnings,Craver Saver / Braver,Barefoot Believer

RAW: When a craving comes on, I go for a run, or do something physical that helps to shake it off, especially if people in my network are too busy to talk. I acknowledge the craving as just a craving. It doesn’t need to consume me. I minimize the cravings by getting outside of my head. I try not to spend too much time thinking about what I’m feeling. My mind can take me to very strange places. Today, I live in action, not thought. It’s realistic to have cravings in recovery. I reduce these cravings by forming new habits. When cravings strike, I am more likely to go to a meeting now, than go use drugs.
CATS: CRAVINGS / will power & tools,CHANGE / action & behavior,HABITS,INNER POWER / Tools
WELLGOS: Inner Anointer,Inner Power Allower,New Pattern Painter / confidence & awareness,Bad Habit Butcher,Self awareness / habits & behavior

RAW: I know what makes me tick, and I know what situations may cause a craving. I have witnessed these same situations become difficult for fellow friends in recovery, and also for myself.
CATS: TRIGGERS / awareness,URGES / moods & emotions,CRAVINGS / vulnerability & learning,WARNINGS / Relapse & tools
WELLGOS: SELF HARM / Warnings,Little Hint Listener,Trigger Auditor,I-examiner - reactions & behavior,Self awareness / confidence to admit,VULNERABILITY / Radical self honesty

RAW: I would use drugs, feel guilty about what I was doing, and then use again to numb that guilt. This cycle continued for far too long. The first step I made was to put down the drugs. I am breaking my cycle of drug addiction. But I am also breaking the cycle of bad habits that would ultimately lead me to use again. Anger and sadness are triggers---but now, instead of reacting to such feelings, I respond. I hang around people who have more experience than me. They help me, through doing, how to break these cycles.
CATS: EMOTIONS,INNER MASTERY / beliefs & awareness,COMMUNITY / listen to guidance
WELLGOS: Illogical Looper,Pattern Interrupter,Feelings Felicitizer,Bad Habit Butcher,Emotions Elixir

RAW: I did damage while using, I hurt myself, and others more than I’d like to think about. But the truth is, remembering my damage is the only way I can heal from it. I remain honest about this damage. I confess to others about the wreckage of my past, so I can face it, and heal. There have been uncomfortable times in recovery, when I had to face my shame without the numbing effect of opiates. I couldn’t run away anymore. Making amends was one of those times----not many, but some people really interrogated me when I was trying to apologize. It hurt. But, I didn’t shift the blame, or get mad at them, I listened to them, and I accepted the damage I caused.
CATS: CONFESSION / damage & hurt,AMENDS,ACCOUNTABILITY / damage confess
WELLGOS: Bitter Truth Taster,Amender Amen’r,Damage Detective,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Inventory,ADMIT / accountability

RAW: I repair the damage I have caused by changing my behaviors. It’s a slow process. It may not happen overnight, but it is possible. I am attached to certain behaviors, behaviors like finding romance before I am ready, reverting back to anger, or taking shortcuts at work. Often, I am scared of letting go---these behaviors were my defense mechanism for so long. Today, I fight through that fear and remember that nothing is worse than using. I pick up the tools, and I repair myself today.
CATS: HEALING,GROWTH / learning & mistakes,CONFESSION / damage & hurt,ACCOUNTABILITY / damage confess,BABY STEPS / slow changes
WELLGOS: Relationship Redeemer,Damage Doctor,Amender Amen’r,Healing #2,ADMIT / healing

RAW: While using, I had this habit of making excuses for my behaviors. Often, if I were late for class or work, I would rationalize that there was absolutely nothing I could do to change that, and that these results had nothing to do with me. Ultimately, everyone saw through it. I didn’t succeed in anything I did. I hit dead ends all the time, and I couldn’t see it was my fault. In sobriety, I avoid rationalizing as much as possible, and begin to learn how to stay accountable.
CATS: EXCUSES,RESPONSIBILITY,DEAD END,ACCOUNTABILITY / Own up
WELLGOS: Rationalization Rinser,Excuse X’r,Responsibility Rebooter,Dead End Deluder,ADMIT / accountability

RAW: Somewhere beneath the surface, beneath just the using body, there was the real me---a hurt, scared individual, wishing for freedom. The pain I was in was so deep, one 12-step meeting wasn’t going to fix me. The levels my addiction took me to were in the darkest places, and it is in those times I remember thinking, “I’m either going to die, or change.” I found strength within myself to want to change. And I did.
CATS: HEALING,INNER POWER / Vulnerability,INNER /SELF / true self,CHANGE / courage
WELLGOS: Dead End Defier ,Whole Soul Healer,Inner Soul X-Rayer,Killer Kickstarter,Grave Trigger,RAW SOUL REVEALER / costs

RAW: One of the greatest parts of recovery is that I no longer have to delay my desires. In addiction, all I did was use; I put my entire life on hold. Without the need to use, I can accomplish anything. I wanted to graduate college. In recovery, I did. I wanted to just be able to look people in the eye, and not constantly be staring at my feet. With the encouragement from others, and watching those who are staying clean and achieving their goals, I am naturally becoming more successful.
CATS: WORTHINESS / new life & future,CHANGE / motivations,GROWTH / successes
WELLGOS: Inner Winner,I-Can-ographer,Missi-Un-Impossiblizer ,The Successcalator,The Dynamotivator

RAW: Oh how comfortable I become in addiction. It was this horrible cycle of doing and becoming everything I hated, but being so scared of life and stepping out of my comfort zone, I had to keep doing it. Not today. Today, I move with the universe. I tolerate my discomfort. I accept it, and keep going. Leaving unhealthy relationships was not comfortable in recovery, but I did it anyway. I know no longer tolerate these levels of discomfort. I am growing and changing, and learning how to be comfortable with the uncomfortable.
CATS: RESILIENCE / discomfort,GROWTH / learning & mistakes,INNER MASTERY / strength
WELLGOS: Adversity Avenger,Challenge Ninja,Courage Commander,Fear Flusher,Hurtle Hugger

RAW: Life stressors are a very real thing, and often trigger my desire to take the edge off. Relationship turmoil is a common stressor for me. When my partner and I fight, I get very emotional, usually feeling helpless. I get so in my head about what they said, taking the edge off seems like a good idea. But after some time in the program, I realize those problems would only magnify if I used. Yes, it would be nice to take the edge off once in awhile. Life is hard. I could use a break. But the level I take it to just isn’t conducive to living...period. I will move away from that mentality; my view on life is different, I don’t feel the need to take the edge off. My perspective has changed. I am not the victim. Life can be hard, but it is also beautiful. I don’t need to run away from life by ‘taking the edge off.’ It’s not who I am anymore.
CATS: INNER POWER / Self control & willpower,CHANGE / action & behavior,TRIGGERS / confidence & strength
WELLGOS: Stress Auditor,Conflict Evictor,Trigger SOS’r,Perspective Detective,Mentality Mender,Inner Power Allower,Inner Trash Trasher

RAW: Without drugs fogging my mind, I can regulate my emotions much easier. I am clearer. Though I am no longer numb because of painkillers, and have many more emotions, I am still able get through them, instead of only numb them. I avoid getting overly angry anymore, or overly sad. When I indulge in either of these emotions, I typically go to very negative places. I begin to cap my anger and sadness, and find positive ways to calm down. I am learning to walk away from situations that fuel these emotions. Of course, bad things happen sometimes, but through practicing acceptance, regulating my emotions becomes much easier than before.
CATS: URGES / moods & emotions,INNER MASTERY / tools & processes,MINDSET / Clear headed
WELLGOS: Emotions Engineer,Void Avoider,The Mindfulizer,Self Awareness Awakener,I-examiner - reactions & behavior

RAW: I was full of excuses in addiction. I excused my behavior as mere cause and effect----the world treats me like, therefore I act like this. After gaining some clean time and sobriety, I begin to hold myself accountable not only for my past, but for my present and future. I make my decisions and I eliminate excuses. I am not helpless. If bad things happened to me while using, chances are it was because I put myself in bad situations just to get more. My self-awareness allows me to examine why I do the things I do, and rid myself of these excuses. It is hard to spot self-deception by yourself. I spend my time with people who expose my excuses, because often, even now, I cannot always tell when I am deceiving myself. If I am pretending that a relationship is good for me, when it has given me nothing but pain, but I am too fearful of letting go, I allow others to step in and offer advice. I remain open to listening to those with more experience. When I cannot see myself clearly, and outside perspective can be the best solution.
CATS: EXCUSES,INNER MASTERY / beliefs & awareness,ACCOUNTABILITY / Own up,COMMUNITY / listen to guidance
WELLGOS: Excuse Exterminator,ADMIT / accountability,VULNERABILITY / listen to others,NEW PATTERN PAINTER / admit & amends

RAW: I avoided uncomfortable feelings like the plague when I was getting high---that’s primarily why I got high. If I got rejected by anyone, or felt slighted, I automatically assumed I was not good enough, and got stuck in those feelings. But if I desire change in my life, if I desire success in any area, flipping those feelings on their side becomes important to me. Staying stuck in them is lethal to my progress as an individual.
CATS: WORTHINESS / self love & acceptance,FREEDOM / future & growth,MINDSET / identify weaknesses,CHANGE / mental confidence
WELLGOS: Feelings Flipper,Mentality Mender,Self Worth Surfer,Progress Painter,Void Avoider,Inner Anointer

RAW: When I hit my bottom, I didn’t know what to do. The only thing I knew was that my life was clearly unmanageable while using. I ran out of gas, for the second time, on a highway, with no one to help me because I had burned every bridge imaginable. Clearly, I could not use successfully, so I took the first step to get clean, and put down the drugs.
CATS: DEAD END,FREEDOM / past & let go,CHANGE / motivations
WELLGOS: Dead End Defier ,Torment Terminator,Killer Kickstarter,Symbolic Stepper,Grave Trigger,Bitter Truth Taster,Demon Greeter

RAW: People helped me when I got clean, and I can only keep all of the tools I have, the perspective I’ve gained, by sharing it with someone else. The feeling I get from helping another is indescribable. Taking someone through step work, and watching them grow through their pain, and get to the other side, is incredible. It’s what connects us. It what keeps us feeling alive, and staying sober. I pay it forward by giving some of my time to others. In addiction, it was all about me, I rarely helped anyone. Today, I practice selflessness, and lend a hand even if I don’t want to.
CATS: GIVING / GENEROSITY,WORTHINESS / connections & sharing,INNER / SELF / beliefs & insight,COMMUNITY / connection with others
WELLGOS: Sobriety Soulmater,Kindness Karmifier,The Empathologist,RELATIONSHIPS / Build connections & community,Ego Eclipser

RAW: Visualizing my future often seemed forced to me. I’m not exactly sure what I want to do, or sometimes I even feel overwhelmed because there’s so much I do want to do. But I apply the “staying in the day,” concept. I set realistic goals. I live in the moment and do what I can for that day. I visualize my future in ways I couldn’t have even dreamed of in addiction. I act responsibly now, so my future is bright, rarely losing site of my most important goals.
CATS: OVERWHELM,PROGRESS / future & hope,MINDSET / obstacles & challenge
WELLGOS: The De-stress-calator,Inner Winner,The Mindfulizer,Growth Gardener,Progress Pollinator,NEW LIFE / POSSIBILITIES

RAW: Instant gratification was my motto in addiction. I expected everything good to come to me without putting in any work. Getting and staying clean requires effort. I actively participate in my recovery, and while my gratification may be delayed, it stays much longer. It isn’t just about using. If I take short cuts in anything I do, I get short-circuited results. If I rush through an assignment for work or school, just so I can leave early, the work itself is usually mediocre. This mediocrity prevents me from making an impression on anyone, ultimately becoming unsuccessful. And then I am unhappy, and I wonder why. Gratification comes to me, and stays with me, only when I give my all.
CATS: MINDSET / obstacles & challenge,INNER MASTERY / tools & processes,BABY STEPS / slow changes
WELLGOS: The Successcalator,Values VIP’r,Bad Habit Butcher,Autopilot Auto X’r,Lazy Zapper,WAIT AND SWITCH / Progress

RAW: I do not want to sit in my feelings anymore. I seek help in whatever area I need, and I remain teachable to get the most out of recovery. I used to feel really alone. Now, I am developing a relationship with the world around me, when I work hard and seek the help I need, life really isn’t so unfair, and I feel safe.
CATS: BABY STEPS / Help & support,INNER / SELF / harmony & inner peace,COMMUNITY / ask for assistance,VULNERABILITY / Show true self
WELLGOS: Imperfections TBH,The Benefisher,Self awareness / confidence to admit,Tender Feelings TBH’r,VULNERABILITY / connections

RAW: Holding grudges was common in active addiction, because it allowed me to blame someone else and keep using. By remaining hostile, and ignoring whom I was really angry with, (myself), I could ignore reality, and keep using. When I am practicing meditation, and getting comfortable with talking about my feelings in meetings and with others, hostility doesn’t consume me like it used to.
CATS: FREEDOM / tools & strategies,PEACE,RECONCILIATON,COMMUNITY / Meetings & groups
WELLGOS: Blame Changer,Tender Feelings TBH’r,RAW SOUL REVEALER / emotions & urges

RAW: Just by being in recovery, I have a new calmness. Impulses do come, but my mind-set and perspective on life is very different, so they do not stay very long. In sobriety, I struggled through a romantic relationship. My partner kept using, and eventually, cheating, and I kept excusing their behavior. I kept thinking I could fix them. Becoming so blind to what was actually happening. I acted impulsively every time I was ready to them go, I changed my mind at the last second, and always took them back. The pain, in recovery, was unimaginable. Breaking away was my only option. Learning to control my impulses was my only option. With the right tactics to combat these impulses, like self-respect, self-love, meetings, and other people, I am stronger than the impulses.
CATS: TRIGGERS / confidence & strength,INNER POWER / Self control & willpower,MINDSET / no matter what
WELLGOS: Bad Influence Butcher,Pain Abstainer,Self Control 101'r,Urge Auditor,Placid Reflux,Craverade

RAW: I do not need to become Ghandi to find inner peace. I was in absolute turmoil while using, and just putting down the drugs gives me hope to find inner peace. Learning and practicing self-acceptance has been monumental in finding my inner peace. Disliking myself was one of the many reasons I used. When I do self-esteem-able things----I get self-esteem. When I have self-esteem, inner peace is attainable.
CATS: SERENITY,WORTHINESS / self love & acceptance,INNER / SELF / awareness,INNER / SELF / harmony & inner peace
WELLGOS: Inner Guru Guarder,Serenity Simulator,Self Esteem Elixir,Peace Weaver,Whole Soul Healer

RAW: It’s not easy to soul search and get honest about all of the parts of me---all of the negative parts. Because as soon as I get honest, I know I have to change, and that is scary. But in order to change my ways, all of those ways that led me to using in the first place, I take my inventory, daily. I ignored who I was while using. I couldn’t look at myself. It was too painful. Today, I look straight into my own eyes, and face my issues. It is important I become comfortable with taking my own inventory, in case I start hurting myself, or others again. I am not invincible just because I am clean. I make mistakes. If I can see myself clearly though, I can change those behaviors.
CATS: INNER / SELF / Inventory,CONFIDENCE /  obstacles & challenge,INNER MASTERY / beliefs & awareness,CONFESSION / damage & hurt
WELLGOS: Bitter Truth Taster,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Inventory,ADMIT / honesty,VULNERABILITY / Radical self honesty,VULNERABILITY / mistakes & learning

RAW: While using, irrational beliefs were rational to me. I would have a complete anxiety attack if I couldn’t get more blues, dope, or literally any painkiller. It became normal. However, now, this idea has carried over into recovery when dealing with other beliefs. For instance, when my mind tells me I can’t do something, I have the faith and experience to know that’s not true--- anything can happen if I stay clean.
CATS: MINDSET,CONFIDENCE /  obstacles & challenge,CHANGE / courage,INNER MASTERY / strength
WELLGOS: Old Belief Butcher,Missi-Un-Impossiblizer ,Can’t Cutter,Inner Power Allower,I-examiner - motivations,Inner Winner

RAW: Judging others has actually been more of a challenge now, than in active addiction. As I grow, my expectations for myself are higher, and so are my expectations for others. I try to push myself to my full potential, and when I see my friends not doing that, it’s easy to judge them. Understanding that my truth is different than someone else’s is a hard concept to grasp sometimes, but I am learning.
CATS: JUDGMENTS,EGO,PRIDE ,MINDSET / imperfection & acceptance
WELLGOS: Ego X’r,Pride Puffer,Arrogance Arrestor,Judgment Junker,VULNERABILITY / mistakes & learning

RAW: I am okay with being an addict. I am not ashamed of it. This label is nothing more than a reminder of who I don’t want to be in the future.
CATS: LABELS / STIGMA,FREEDOM / past & let go,GROWTH / proud
WELLGOS: Label Eraser,Stigma Striker,NEW LIFE / POSSIBILITIES,The Hopenotizer,ADMIT / True self & vulnerability

RAW: Relapsing happens before I relapse. I start to think about stealing before I steal for drugs, I start losing self-discipline---starting small with not making my bed as often, and then suddenly thinking about stealing from stores. It goes from minor thoughts, to thinking about stealing for drugs. And then, once I relapse, all of the shame and guilt I was getting over, comes flooding back. I usually have two choices---keep using, or go back to recovery. If I relapse, it is important I forgive myself, and tell other people about it. Keeping quiet is way too dangerous, because staying accountable to myself, and others, promotes prevention, and future slip ups.
CATS: LAPSE,ACCOUNTABILITY / Own up,WARNINGS / Relapse & tools,COMMUNITY / ask for assistance
WELLGOS: SELF HARM / Warnings,Inner Forgiverizer,ADMIT / accountability,VULNERABILITY / share relapse

RAW: While relapse does happen, it doesn’t need to. I do not want to lessen the danger of what a relapse could mean. Keeping strong resources in place, and putting as many things, (hobbies, goals, people), between myself, and the drugs, is so important. If I relapse, or if others I know relapse; I learn from it. It is a reminder that I am not immortal, or invincible, but I am strong enough to get through it and stay clean.
CATS: LAPSE,TRIGGERS / tools & techniques,GROWTH / learning & mistakes,MINDSET / obstacles & challenge
WELLGOS: Lapse Lessenizer,Addiction AMF’r,VULNERABILITY / mistakes & learning,SELF HARM ALARMER / avoid triggers

RAW: I get honest about my desires to use. I open up in meetings, and on the phone, and let go of the fear of judgment. The second I realize, I haven’t “arrived,” is when my recovery is strongest. Attending meetings enough times, many days in a row, allows a new habit to form, often preventing future relapses.
CATS: CRAVINGS / support & help,COMMUNITY / Meetings & groups,CONFESSION,ACCOUNTABILITY / Own up
WELLGOS: CLOSET CONFESSOR / Face truths,ADMIT / honesty,RAW SOUL REVEALER / emotions & urges,NEW PATTERN PAINTER / support groups,VULNERABILITY / share challenges

RAW: I keep myself in check, mostly through self-awareness, and allowing myself to remain open to loving criticism. Others usually remind me if I’m becoming too moody, or if I’m drifting back into some old behaviors. I monitor my behaviors through others’ responses, and my own feelings. I’ve become very in tune with myself, and when something is off, I notice. When I stay clean longer, I desire more for myself. When I am upset over something, instead of sulking; it is much more common for me to perform self-talk. I learn how to make myself feel better. I elevate my mood, and take responsibility for my own life.
CATS: MOODS,INNER POWER / Vulnerability,MINDSET / identify weaknesses,INNER / SELF / awareness
WELLGOS: Self Awareness Awakener,Moody MF’r,Soul Tuner,Inner Eye Opener,RAW SOUL REVEALER / emotions & urges

RAW: My motivations for staying clean change everyday. But what never changes, is the acknowledgment that life gets harder when I use, and easier when I don’t. I keep it simple.
CATS: PROGRESS / future & hope,SOBRIETY / maintaining & will power,MINDSET / Future sobriety,GROWTH / motivation & boosts
WELLGOS: Pain Abstainer,Killer Kickstarter,I-examiner - motivations

RAW: The way my mind works has changed so much since I’ve stayed clean. When a negative thought comes, it’s hard for me to take it seriously. A lot of times, the thought is something ridiculous, like at the end of a break up, I’ll think, “you’re going to be alone forever!” That’s insane. I usually start laughing at my craziness, and know my emotions are just taking over logic in that moment. Recovery has given me a pause button, to stop and think, and I am so grateful.
CATS: FREEDOM / tools & strategies,MINDSET / Clear headed,CHANGE / mental confidence,INNER / SELF / awareness
WELLGOS: Old Belief Butcher,Mentality Mender,Insanity SOS’r,THOUGHTS / aware & examine,Inner Eye Opener

RAW: I nip negative thoughts in the bud whenever they arise. If I retrain my mind, then that must mean I am stronger than my mind. When I was consumed by negativity in addiction, I used to tell myself I wasn’t worthy of a happy life, because if I was, I would’ve found it already. But in actuality, I wasn’t putting the footwork in to achieve anything. It was not until recovery, when people started telling me, and I started seeing, how people change their life. It’s about action. Showing up for life is how you receive all of the perks of life. If I’m not there and be apart of, how will I receive the benefits? I stay positive now, but not just in thought, in action. When focus on doing, rather than thinking and sulking, life gets better.
CATS: CHANGE / action & behavior,CONFIDENCE /  hope & future,WORTHINESS / new life & future
WELLGOS: The Wellectrifier,Negativity Ninja,Inner Motor Motivator,I-examiner - reactions & behavior

RAW: I take a real look at how often I am experiencing negative thoughts. If my whole mindset starts to change, I reevaluate my program. Am I showing up for my responsibilities? Am I taking care of myself physically, mentally, and emotionally? When negative thoughts become common again, I look at all of these factors, and make changes when necessary.
CATS: INNER POWER / Decisions,MINDSET / Perceptions,CHANGE / thoughts
WELLGOS: Brain Unchainer,SELF HARM / Self honesty & admit,Thought Auditor,I-examiner - motivations

RAW: After getting a taste of what sobriety has to offer, I have no interest in going backwards. In recovery, I have the ability to finish what I start. Gratitude.
CATS: GROWTH / motivation & boosts,CONFIDENCE /  hope & future,CHANGE / motivations
WELLGOS: NEW LIFE / POSSIBILITIES,I-Can-ographer,Killer Kickstarter,Addiction AMF’r,Inner Winner,Inner Freedom Forager

RAW: The most obvious pattern was my using. When I was sad, I used, when I was happy, I used. I broke old patterns, just by getting clean, but other patterns, like staying in relationships way over the expiration date, were ones I had a hard time breaking. It took a ton of trial and error, and a ton of pain, to try something new. Looking for red flags before I get too intimate with someone was one new way of interrupting this pattern. I ended up creating new patterns for my new life. However, on any given day, I could steer off course, which is why self-discipline is so crucial. I stick to a schedule. It keeps me focused.
CATS: MINDSET / will power,CHANGE / action & behavior,INNER MASTERY / self control
WELLGOS: Pattern Interrupter,Self Control 101'r,Bad Habit Butcher,New Pattern Painter / grit & progress,SELF HARM / Warnings

RAW: Before meetings and recovery, I had hard time admitting that I had a problem with drugs, or really, anything at all. I could not admit to being a drug addict for so long. I thought drug addicts were people who slept under bridges----I didn’t do that, so I must be okay. I compared myself to people a lot. It kept me stuck. In recovery, I learn humility, that I am not any better, or any worse, than my fellow addict. And this humility became the antidote for moving forward---- admitting when I have a problem.
CATS: INNER POWER / Vulnerability,GROWTH / learning & mistakes,TRUTH / Admit addiction
WELLGOS: Self awareness / confidence to admit,Bitter Truth Taster,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Share & support,ADMIT / honesty,RAW SOUL REVEALER / past mistakes

RAW: Old behaviors come in many forms. A common one for me is denying when I have a problem. Comparing myself to others, thinking I’m not as bad as them, sometimes even denying how bad my addiction was, just so I could avoid going to meetings was also very real for me. But when I stayed focused, and realize that admitting my issues is the first step to recovery, I can push forward.
CATS: PROGRESS / future & hope,CONFESSION / denial,CHANGE / courage
WELLGOS: Pride Puffer,Bitter Truth Taster,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Admit addiction,ADMIT / honesty,VULNERABILITY / admit

RAW: It is important to acknowledge my progress. No matter what is going on in my life, there is always a silver lining. When I celebrate my clean time at meetings, it gives me the encouragement to stay clean. When I avoid bad relationships, and actually leave earlier than I used to, that progress is celebrated. It’s celebrated by making room for real love to come into my life.
CATS: WORTHINESS / self love & acceptance,FREEDOM / future & growth,GROWTH / celebrate
WELLGOS: Love Kickstarter,Journey Jazzer,Endorphin Flooder,Symbolic Stepper,Joy Kickstarter,The Blessifier

RAW: What propels my progress is step work. Step work and working with a sponsor has pushed my recovery along.
CATS: PROGRESS / support ,GROWTH / motivation & boosts,COMMUNITY / listen to guidance
WELLGOS: Motivation Moonbeamer ,Progress Pollinator,Symbolic Stepper,Sobriety 101'r

RAW: I don’t keep track of how well I am doing necessarily. The proof is in the pudding. When I feel alive, when others are happy with me, and when I feel confident about myself, is a good indication that I am progressing on the right track.
CATS: PROGRESS / future & hope,INNER / SELF / Inventory
WELLGOS: Inner Light Illuminator,Self Awareness Awakener,Inner Freedom Forager,Progress Painter,Joy Sweetener

RAW: I catch myself rationalizing nonsense. This used to happen in addiction, but this can still occur in sobriety. I have a habit of putting relationships before myself. I put my goals on the backburner, just to focus all of my attention on a significant other. I usually make excuses for this behavior, claiming how good this partner is to me, so it’s okay. It’s not okay. When I act like this, it’s usually because I am stuck in my head because of fear, worrying about this person leaving me, instead of worrying about myself, and my plans. When I am over thinking a certain situation, often to my detriment, it is important that I catch myself. Self-awareness from personal inventories helps with this, as well as talking regularly with a sponsor.
CATS: EXCUSES,INNER / SELF / Inventory,INNER MASTERY / beliefs & awareness
WELLGOS: Rationalization Rinser,I-Examiner,Self awareness / confidence to admit,VULNERABILITY / admit

RAW: My emotions tended to be all over the place when I was getting high. Now clean, I still try and keep my emotions in check. Family functions are a good example, because I find myself yelling at people who don’t believe what I believe. It’s great that I have found my voice in recovery, something I didn’t have before, but reacting to people, instead of maturely responding, only hurts me. I am learning how to respond to difficult situations, instead of reacting to them. If I don’t agree with someone, or what someone is doing, examining how I react to them can sometimes be necessary so I do not get stuck in resentment. Resentments were common excuses to use.
CATS: RESILIENCE / reaction & behavior,CONFLICT,TRIGGERS / awareness,SOBRIETY / behavior & action
WELLGOS: Reactions Auditor,Situation Unscrewer,Problem Soul-ver,Conflict Connoisseur,Emotions Auditor

RAW: I cut out people, places, and things from my past. Old dealers were an obvious no-go, and old friends, as hard as it was, needed to go too. I got out of a toxic relationship, and blocked this person’s number, and social media, so I would never be tempted to contact them. Certain songs used to remind me of them, and even some party songs used to remind me of getting high. I deleted anything and everything that reminded me that time in my life. Knowing my weaknesses is, in itself, strength. To avoid/prevent a relapse, I take these important steps.
CATS: INFLUENCES,FREEDOM / past & let go,INNER POWER / Self control & willpower
WELLGOS: Bad Influence Bulldozer,Killer Kickstarter,Self Control 101'r,Inner Guru Guarder,SELF HARM ALARMER / distance from people

RAW: I ran away from my responsibilities when I was getting high. I could barely get to work on some days, often lying so I didn’t have to go. I was so crazed one day, I actually made up a lie that my friend got into a car accident, and I couldn’t make it in. The pain of compromising my integrity just to miss work was way greater than the perks I received from missing work. Today, my responsibilities are taken care of, no matter if they’re at work, or at home.
CATS: CHANGE / action & behavior,RESPONSIBILITY,ACCOUNTABILITY / Own up
WELLGOS: Responsibility Rippler,Values VIP’r,Mentality Mender,Autopilot Auto X’r,ADMIT / accountability

RAW: I do not always have to act out---whether it be actually using, or just bad behavior. It might be familiar, but I feel so much better when I restrain myself. The rewards are endless. I remember one time I wanted to use, and my clean date was only a few days away. I was struggling so hard with it, but I surrounded myself with people every single day until my clean date. And when I stood up, and received that tag, the gratitude was unbelievable.
CATS: SOBRIETY / celebrate & progress,PROGRESS / rewards & proud,GROWTH / successes
WELLGOS: Behavior Savior,Abstainer Amazer,Sober Milestoner,The Successcalator,Symbolic Stepper

RAW: Throughout recovery, I develop an ability to look at myself from the outside. Self-awareness is just that---the ability to see myself objectively, and view my actions as I would another person’s. Analyzing risks becomes easy when you have self-awareness. This awareness has saved my life many times, and I am grateful.
CATS: CHANGE / self love & true self,MINDSET / Perceptions,INNER / SELF / awareness
WELLGOS: Gratitude Grounder,Soul Controller,Self awareness / habits & behavior,VULNERABILITY / Radical self honesty

RAW: In addiction, I had no rules for myself. The only rule was go get your blues/painkillers, before you had class, regardless if being late was a consequence. It was in recovery where I learned the importance of having rules for myself. Boundaries for myself and other people are the most common. People can no longer treat me however they want, but I also will not treat myself poorly anymore. Compromising my beliefs just to fit in was no longer an option for me. I began rewriting the rules for myself, and my self-love grew.
CATS: INNER MASTERY / beliefs & awareness,GROWTH / behavior & habits,CHANGE / self love & true self,ACCOUNTABILITY / Own up
WELLGOS: Responsibility Rebooter,ADMIT / Decisions & beliefs,Values VIP’r,Inner Anointer,Soul Proprietor,Self Worth Surfer

RAW: It’s been said that it is hard to spot self-deception by yourself, which is why I keep positive, self- aware, people around me. Deception is dangerous for staying clean. I stay teachable when they call me out on my behavior; I listen and can actually change.
CATS: DELUSION,INNER / SELF / Inventory,CONFESSION / denial,COMMUNITY / listen to guidance
WELLGOS: Pride Puffer,Ego Eclipser,Delusion Detector,ADMIT / honesty,VULNERABILITY / support from others

RAW: This goes back to acceptance. And it is important to accept situations for what they are, but that doesn’t always mean I should tolerate everything. Staying clean has been about tolerating life on life’s terms, but also not tolerating what will compromise my recovery.
CATS: SITUATIONS,MINDSET / obstacles & challenge,INNER MASTERY / challenge & resilience
WELLGOS: Situation Unscrewer,Inner Power Allower,Adversity Ninja,Void Avoider,Mighty Motor Cranker,ADMIT / honesty

RAW: Each step is something to be grateful for, no matter how big or small, because it is still, miles away from where I’ve come. I am so lucky to be alive, and to celebrate each day clean and sober.
CATS: PROGRESS / rewards & proud,SOBRIETY / celebrate & progress,GROWTH / celebrate
WELLGOS: Baby Step Embracer,Symbolic Stepper,Gratitude Flooder,Joy Kickstarter,Sober Selfie

RAW: I pledge my sobriety for a day at a time. I do not commit to stay sober forever. I know my weaknesses, and I know that those thoughts might make me nervous. I am strong today, and no matter what is going on in my life, I can stay sober.
CATS: SOBRIETY / maintaining & will power,PROGRESS / start small,BABY STEPS / focus on today
WELLGOS: Sobriety 101'r,Symbolic Stepper,The Momentumizer ,I-Can-ographer,Confidence Colonizer,WAIT AND SWITCH / Small steps,COMMITMENT knitter / laziness & effort

RAW: The world thinks what it thinks, but I can change what I think. Being an addict does not have to be embarrassing. When others speak badly about drug addicts, I am typically the first person to try and stop the stigma. But it doesn’t mean it doesn’t hurt. I get through these feelings by surrounding myself with people who understand me, and who don’t judge me.
CATS: LABELS / STIGMA,WORTHINESS / connections & sharing,CHANGE / mental confidence,COMMUNITY / healthy relationships
WELLGOS: Stigma Striker,Alienation Alleviationator,Worthy Soul’r,RELATIONSHIPS / Build connections & community

RAW: Opiates gave me so much relief in those first few moments of inhalation. They used to be my only way to handle stress. And now just because I’m clean and sober, it doesn’t mean my life is perfect. I monitor my stress levels with meditation, and personal time for myself. I soothe my stress with various body/workouts. Yoga, meditation, exercise, and even reading, often help to soothe my stress levels.
CATS: HABITS,GROWTH / supporting myself,INNER / SELF / balance
WELLGOS: Behavior Savior,New Pattern Painter / confidence & awareness,Peace Kickstarter,Placid Reflux,Inner Anointer

RAW: Stress triggers are the most common form of triggers. Between school, or work, or relationships, stress can trigger some of the worst desires to use than really anything else. I am just getting out of another relationship, which is a trigger in itself. But this relationship was one rollercoaster of a ride, and every time they would leave, the stress was through the roof. It takes time to get better with these things. I am still learning. But I am always talking about it. I am trying my hardest to stay relaxed. I use calming techniques to soothe stress. I used for many reasons. Stress triggers were the most common, but really, just living, was a trigger at certain points in my addiction. Today, I am identifying the real stressors in my life, and eliminating them and/or alleviating them.
CATS: TRIGGERS / tools & techniques,INNER MASTERY / challenge & resilience,STRESS
WELLGOS: Stress X’r,The De-stress-calator,Placid Reflux,The Dynamotivator,Nerve Ninja

RAW: I am not afraid of requesting support from others or asking for help. Seeking support is how I stay clean. Without support from my network, watching and learning from their experiences, and without the support of a higher power, I would feel alone. When I feel alone, the likelihood of me using becomes very high.
CATS: WORTHINESS / connections & sharing,COMMUNITY / ask for assistance,VULNERABILITY / others who’ve been there
WELLGOS: Loneliness TLC’r,Low Vibration Lifter,VULNERABILITY / reach out for help

RAW: Coming into recovery, people taught me how to get below the surface. They taught me how to get in touch with my real feelings. I became so used to it after awhile, I started getting overly honest with people, and probably telling them too much about me! Through opening up and sharing, I have learned how to settle some past resentments. This new level of honesty has brought me closer to the real me, and I am so grateful. The closer I get to knowing myself, and creating myself, the farther I get from drug use.
CATS: FREEDOM / future & growth,COMMUNITY / sharing,INNER /SELF / true self
WELLGOS: Deep Down Diver,NEW LIFE / POSSIBILITIES,Tender Feelings TBH’r,Whole Soul Healer,RAW SOUL REVEALER / trust others,VULNERABILITY / share emotions

RAW: My thought processes were sometimes unhealthy. I challenge that today. I no longer spend time worrying about what someone said or didn’t say; I simply ask them what they meant, how they meant it, and remain calm. The insecure, unhealthy ways I used to think doesn’t need to control me anymore. I take inventory of my crazy thoughts. I monitor the negative self-talk in my head pretty easily because I have gained so much self-awareness. Even if I don’t always believe the positive self- talk, I do everything in my power to focus on it, until I do.
CATS: INNER / SELF / Inventory,INNER MASTERY / beliefs & awareness,CHANGE / beliefs
WELLGOS: Mentality Mender,Illogical Looper,Thought Auditor,Self awareness / confidence to admit

RAW: I avoid triggers by cutting out people I used to use with, places I used to use at, and various things that remind me of using. These are my trigger identifiers. As I stay clean longer, I may identify new triggers. Anything new that comes up, whether it be a new insecurity, a fear of something, I talk about it with a sponsor. I eliminate triggers by simply avoiding them, if and when I can. I practice the principles of recovery everyday, and after awhile, the triggers fade.
CATS: TRIGGERS / tools & techniques,INFLUENCES,PROGRESS / reactions & behavior,COMMUNITY / sharing
WELLGOS: Bad Influence Bulldozer,Trigger X’r,Sobriety 101'r,Self Control 101'r,SELF HARM ALARMER / avoid triggers

RAW: In addiction, I had perpetual urges. They didn’t stop. In sobriety, I have urges, but the desire to resist and control them is greater than the desires themselves. When meetings, and talking to other recovering addicts becomes routine, these urges are rarely consuming, and controlling and resisting them becomes just as routine.
CATS: URGES / tools & techniques,MINDSET / will power,PROGRESS / reactions & behavior,INNER MASTERY / take a step back
WELLGOS: Urge Auditor,Self Control 101'r,Inner Winner,Soul Controller,Inner Power Allower,WAIT AND SWITCH / Emotions

RAW: Life can be scary. It can be scary especially when I don’t have drugs to run to, but I try and keep my eye on the big picture. I put in the footwork today, so tomorrow can be brighter. And as long as I’m doing that, it’s up to the universe to figure out the rest. I relax. And I ride the waves, and go with the flow.
CATS: WORTHINESS / new life & future,FREEDOM / future & growth,GROWTH / willing to change,INNER / SELF / balance
WELLGOS: "20000 Foot Viewer",Destiny Autopiloter,Serenity Soulmater,Peace Sweetener,Placid Reflux

RAW: When I used drugs, most of my feelings were numbed. If I was in a ton of pain from destroying my life, or feeling nervous in any way, it didn’t last very long, because the drugs were there. But now, when dealing with real life, with real feelings, and no drugs, I’m learning how to fight these nerves. When I feel nervous, usually from even the most typical life situations---going to class, job interviews, dates, etc., I breathe through my nervousness. I remind myself why these new things are a blessing, and how far I’ve come from where I used to be---it all helps to combat my nerves a bit. When I feel nervous, I remember how shot my nerves were while using. While feeling them is a bit uncomfortable, I’m grateful that I can actually feel something again. That thought gives me some comfort, and allows me to get past the uneasiness of my nerves. When I feel nervous, I remember how shot my nerves are when I resist. When I fight. When I try to do it all on my own. While using, I didn’t ask myself much, other than, “how can I get more?” But now, I hold myself to higher standards, and often have inner dialogue about what I am feeling, and what I can do about it. When I am nervous, I ask, “why do you feel that way,” or “what’s so scary that you can’t get through?” The answer is usually nothing.
CATS: WORRY,CONFIDENCE / action & behavior,MINDSET / identify weaknesses
WELLGOS: Nerve Ninja,Worry POW’r,Panic Patroller,I-examiner - reactions & behavior,Tender Feelings TBH’r,Placid Reflux

RAW: ￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼Anxiety comes on as quickly as it leaves. And I remember that when I am faced with it. I have to turn how I feel into something else, something positive, to get through it. For example, when I feel a rush of anxiety before I am about to do something important, like give a talk, or a presentation of some kind, I turn it into motivation to get it done. I turn my anxious energy into action, and use it to accomplish goals, instead of stop them. When using, I didn’t know how to feel anything. I ran from every feeling by numbing them with drugs. I am realizing the importance of feeling my feelings, and riding out the anxiety. It is normal I feel this way. I am living clean---an abnormal state for me, so it makes sense I feel this way. When I understand that, it is easier to ride the angst out. I used to not know what to do about my anxiety. I now have resources to help ease it. I often go to meetings, or talk to people in my network, who understand what I am going through. I feel less alone, and it helps calm me.
CATS: ANXIETY,MINDSET / tolerate discomfort,GROWTH / supporting myself,COMMUNITY / ask for assistance
WELLGOS: Anxiety Elixir,Inner Soul X-Rayer,Feelings Felicitizer,VULNERABILITY / share emotions

RAW: There is an inner system inside me now. It functions without my permission. I have become much more susceptible to feelings now that I’m clean, and it acts as a behavior monitor. When I act out, it feels wrong, and I don’t like that feeling.
CATS: VALUES,APOLOGY,ACCOUNTABILITY / Own up
WELLGOS: My Badiator,Values VIP’r,Amender Amen’r,Relationship Redeemer

RAW: I don’t necessarily have to broadcast my confessions to confess to myself Not everything in recovery is about spilling my guts to other people or going around to every person I have harmed and apologizing. Sometimes, dialogue with myself, getting honest about what I’ve done, and what improvements could be made, is just as important. Honesty with myself, and at least one other person becomes extremely helpful in forgiving myself for what I have done clean, and also in addiction. It can get embarrassing when I hurt someone in recovery and do not have drugs as an excuse to fall back on. If I am honest with myself about my faults in the situation, I apologize faster, and tend to not repeat that behavior again.
CATS: CONFESSION / apology & forgiveness,AMENDS,ACCOUNTABILITY / Own up,INNER / SELF / Inventory
WELLGOS: Self Awareness Awakener,Inner Forgiverizer,Inner Freedom Forager,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Inventory,VULNERABILITY / admit

RAW: I am not perfect, and make many mistakes, even clean and sober. Becoming involved in quarrels or fights happens, but my reaction is most important for my personal growth. Quashing quarrels and knowing how and when to pick my battles becomes crucial for personal growth because why waste my time feeling bad feelings? I have a whole new life now. I do not have time to get angry over things that are not that important. I wasted enough time using. Just because I am clean and trying to be a better person, doesn’t mean everyone else around is doing the same thing. Daily, I experience others who react poorly to certain situations, and often cannot handle their feelings. That used to be me. But today, I can pause and allow them to be who they are, and react calmly and appropriately to help diffuse the situation.
CATS: MINDSET / imperfection & acceptance,RECONCILIATON,CONFIDENCE / action & behavior,RESILIENCE / reaction & behavior,INNER / SELF / patterns
WELLGOS: Quarrel Quasher,Imperfections TBH,Blemishes TBH,Kindness Karmifier,Placid Reflux

RAW: It doesn’t always matter how or why I get angry. But I do. It matters more how I handle it. I’ve become a kind of anger gangster in the process of getting clean. If I allow anger to consume me, I am more susceptible to use, and my life is too important to let that happen. Coming off drugs/alcohol made me very irritable. It was hard to be around others, and for others to be around me. Rehab creates a safe space for me to express and discuss my anger with counselors. But when I am home, it is more difficult, and I learn from others how to get my anger out in healthy ways. Exercising and usually some kind of creative outlet, help.
CATS: REACTIONS,COMMUNITY / Meetings & groups,TRIGGERS / tools & techniques,INNER MASTERY / take a step back
WELLGOS: Anger Gangster,Aggravation Vacationer,The Irrita-shunner

RAW: Anger is a very real feeling for me and a very scary feeling for me because it is an emotion that is probably the easiest one to express. I have to self-regulate and stop myself from overreacting because the situation almost always gets worse.
CATS: ANGER,PROGRESS / reactions & behavior,EMOTIONS,MINDSET / identify weaknesses
WELLGOS: The Defuriator,Scary Stepper,Emotions Emancipator,Reactions Auditor,Soul Controller

RAW: It is said that for every action, there is a reaction. As I recover, I take an honest look at myself in the mirror, for possibly the first time in my adult life. It is important that I explore the mistakes that I have made in my active addiction and face the consequences of my actions. Denying my mistakes does not make me better, it only feeds my addiction.
CATS: RESPONSIBILITY,ACCOUNTABILITY / Own up,TRUTH / Inventory,CONFESSION / damage & hurt
WELLGOS: VULNERABILITY / mistakes & learning,Bitter Truth Taster,My Badiator,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Inventory,ADMIT / accountability

RAW: It is important for me to compare the benefits of my recovery behaviors with the cost of my continued addiction. In my life, I have experienced the devastating consequences of addiction by losing a job, a relationship, savings, self-esteem and personal dignity. As a recovered person, I stand to gain way more than I ever lost. By continued hard work, I can realize the promises of my recovery such as: a promising career, repaired relationships, financial freedom, and increased self-esteem. More importantly, I get my life back and get my self-dignity back, I can hold my head up high.
CATS: CONFIDENCE,WORTHINESS / new life & future,SOBRIETY / costs & benefits,PROGRESS / rewards & proud
WELLGOS: Lost Benefit Lamenter,Confidence Caffeinator,NEW LIFE / POSSIBILITIES,Journey Jazzer,Self Esteem Engineer,I-Can-ographer

RAW: I am triggered by strong emotions such as loneliness, fatigue, anger, jealousy and even love. As I experience sobriety, I am given the opportunity to connect with people and share my feelings more honestly. In my disease, I was not even aware of my feelings, as I recover, I gain new insights and awareness that I can share with others. By dealing with my emotions, I can face life head-on rather than running away from them and using. Before recovery, I used to bury by feelings so that I wouldn’t have to look at them or deal with them. I am so grateful for the emotional healing that I have experienced as a direct result of my recovery.
CATS: EMOTIONS,VULNERABILITY / learning and mistakes,COMMUNITY / sharing
WELLGOS: Whole Soul Healer,Emotions Elixir,RELATIONSHIPS / Trust & vulnerability,RELATIONSHIPS / Build connections & community

RAW: Can the damage that I have done to the relationships due to my disease be repaired? In my relapse, there were things that I did that impacted my children, my husband, my friends and even my dog. I wrote letters to each of my children and husband as part of my 5th step and shared with them the things that I did in my disease that I was sorry for. Because of my disease, I often did not do the things that I should have to take care of my family. I was angry, resentful and disagreeable and downright unpleasant to be around. Another way that I make amends to my family is a living amends. I try, one day at a time, to make up for the errors in my past, to give them the love, respect and care that they deserve.
CATS: AMENDS,CONFESSION / damage & hurt,RECONCILIATON,ACCOUNTABILITY / Amends
WELLGOS: The First Amender,Damage Doctor,So Sorry Soother,Relationship Dedamager,ADMIT / healing

RAW: Being an addict in active food addiction takes a tremendous amount of time and energy from my life. I have lost hours, days, weeks, months and years to my compulsive overeating and relapse. Recovery steals that time and I do not get it back. Because, every moment in my life is precious, today I choose to live it to the fullest, in a positive way. I no longer want to live my life with the covers over my head and the shades drawn, life is too short.
CATS: FREEDOM / past & let go,CONFIDENCE /  hope & future,MINDSET,CHANGE / motivations
WELLGOS: Lost Benefit Lamenter,Killer Kickstarter,Grave Trigger,Addiction AMF’r

RAW: As an addict, I seem to think that I am the only one that ever experiences discomfort. The discomfort I feel is multi-faceted: physical, emotional, and spiritual. One of the things that I work on is to push through my discomfort. They say in recovery, the only way out is through. For today, I accept my discomfort and reflect on where it is coming from and how I can deal with it in a healthier way to get to the other side.
CATS: RESILIENCE / discomfort,INNER MASTERY / tools & processes,BABY STEPS / focus on today
WELLGOS: Ill Feelings Illuminator,Inner Soul X-Rayer,Soul Surgeon,Hurtle Hugger,Emotions Emancipator,Bruise Controller,WAIT AND SWITCH / Emotions

RAW: Moving forward in recovery is about one step at a time, one moment at a time, and one situation at a time. Addiction dulls the senses but provides only instant gratification. Delaying gratification is about being present 100% of the time. Gratitude is an attitude, not something I get from material possessions. It is helpful to focus on what I have and not what I don’t have. Writing a daily gratitude list each day is a way to be mindful of my daily blessings. Sometimes, if I am having a difficult time, the only thing I can be grateful for is my family and warm bed to sleep in. Other days, the blessings roll off my pen.
CATS: GRATITUDE / progress & growth,PROGRESS / future & hope,BABY STEPS / slow changes
WELLGOS: Daily Daisy Spotter,Blessings Bather,Joy Sweetener,Journey Jazzer,Gratitude Grower,Baby Step Embracer

RAW: Happiness is everywhere. But sometimes in the fog of addiction, I cannot see or feel it. Happiness can be enjoying that first cup of coffee or tea in the morning. Happiness can be taking a nice, slow, long walk. Happiness can be remembering a friend’s birthday. Happiness is always within reach. The question is will I reach for it or sit and wait and hope for happiness to come to me? Is the glass half full or half empty? Take the time for happiness to seep in, each day. Experience happiness fully in the moment.
CATS: JOY,FREEDOM,MINDSET / Clear headed,INNER / SELF / harmony & inner peace
WELLGOS: Joy Flooder,Inner Child Smiler,Wellectricity Generator,Rainbow Hunter,Grace Moonlighter,Journey Jazzer,Bliss Kisser

RAW: Taking a 4th Step Inventory in OA allowed me to clear away the wreckage of my past. I was able to bring my past resentments and mistakes into the light and discuss them with a sponsor who had more experience than I did. I thought that she would say that I was a bad person and had a past more horrible than anyone she ever worked with. She did not, she continued to love me unconditionally and support me in my recovery. After I shared my 4th step for the 1st time, I felt like the weight of the world was lifted off of my shoulders. I no longer felt alone, I felt hopeful.
CATS: PROGRESS / future & hope,WORTHINESS / self love & acceptance,COMMUNITY / listen to guidance
WELLGOS: Worthiness Whisperer,Hope Harvester,Worthy Soul’r,VULNERABILITY / support from others

RAW: Who am I to judge another child of God? Am I so perfect that I can look at someone else and assume I know what is best for another person? Sometimes, I instinctively judge others. One time, I was boarding a plane and a woman was dressed kind of crazily, my first instinct was to assume that she wasn’t wrapped too tight. Guess where her seat was? Right next to mine. Then, to top it off, she got out a mask before the flight started. As it turned out, we spoke at length on the flight, she was a lovely person and we shared a great deal. If I had gone with my first instinct, that something was wrong with her because of the way she was dressed, I never would have had the pleasure of the connection we had on that flight. God intervened on that flight to teach me an important lesson.
CATS: JUDGMENTS,GROWTH / learning & mistakes,INNER / SELF / beliefs & insight
WELLGOS: VULNERABILITY / mistakes & learning,Judgment Jailer,Insight Inseminator

RAW: I have learned many lessons in my relapses. Have they kept me from never having another relapse, no they haven’t. I have heard it said in the rooms that relapse is a part of recovery. Does that mean that I have to keep going backwards in my recovery and picking up addictive substances? What it means for me is that I learn from my recovery and I also learn from my relapses. One the hugest messages I learned recently was that God sometimes lets other addicts die to teach lessons to those of us that are still living. Did that lesson keep me clean permanently? Unfortunately, it did not. Is it a driving force in my hope to live a life of recovery until the day I die? Yes, it is.
CATS: RELAPSE,GROWTH / learning & mistakes,CHANGE / beliefs
WELLGOS: Lapse Lessonizer,Motivation Moonbeamer ,VULNERABILITY / mistakes & learning,SELF HARM / Self honesty & admit,Killer Kickstarter

RAW: Lazy thinking keeps me in relapse. Everything is too hard, I do not want to change, and I want to stay stuck. Today, I want to think positively, try harder, make changes and get better. I can proactively focus on thinking and doing things that support my recovery. Do I want to give up some days? Yes, I do. Am I terminally unique? No, I am not. With God’s help and a shift in my thinking, I can get better one day at a time.
CATS: GROWTH / motivation & boosts,PROGRESS / future & hope,CHANGE / mental confidence,BABY STEPS / slow changes
WELLGOS: Lazy Zapper,The Procrastina-shunner,THOUGHTS / positivity,Symbolic Stepper,I-Can-ographer,New Pattern Painter / grit & progress,COMMITMENT knitter / laziness & effort

RAW: My normal state of thinking before my recovery was that of a depressed victim. Everyone was always doing things to me that made me upset. If it wasn’t for all the bad things that I had to done to me, I would be ok. What I learned is the only person that I can change is myself. By drowning my sorrows in addictive substances, I never allowed myself to simply ride out the rough spots. Today, I choose to feel my feelings and look at life in a more positive light. I have also learned not to focus my energy on trying to change other people and I focus on changing myself, that’s enough work.
CATS: CHANGE / self love & true self,GROWTH / behavior & habits,ACCOUNTABILITY / De-blame
WELLGOS: Responsibility 101’r,Victimhood Veto’r,Inner Trash Trasher,Soul Controller

RAW: For many I who cope with addiction, old beliefs often get in the way. I get stuck in thinking a certain way and can often be extremely head strong. When I am in this mode, it’s a lot like being stuck in deep mud with really poor boots. The feet don’t move. The body begins to panic. Then, there’s no movement and I am completely stuck. I forget that old beliefs can and should be challenged and even changed.
CATS: MINDSET / obstacles & challenge,CHANGE / beliefs,INNER / SELF / beliefs & insight
WELLGOS: Old Belief Butcher,Mentality Mender,I-Examiner,Inner Soul X-Rayer

RAW: DENIAL – stands for Don’t Even Know I am Lying. They say, how do you know an addicts is lying? Their lips are moving. I spend so much time lying to others that I often don’t even realize that I am lying to myself. I tell myself things like, I’m not as bad as Jack, he’s really bad. I don’t use like that person, I don’t have a problem. I have it under control. Admitting I have a problem is probably one of the hardest parts of recovery, but once I take that step, I am well on my way to a better life.
CATS: INNER POWER / Vulnerability,CONFESSION / denial,CHANGE / courage,TRUTH / Admit addiction
WELLGOS: Denial Denyer,ADMIT / True self & vulnerability,Bitter Truth Taster,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Admit addiction

RAW: In my life philosophy there is no abstinence or sobriety without support. The people who truly love us understand our experience and they do so without judgments. For those of us who have experienced an addiction or dependency, there is a world of support available to us. I found them in my close friends and my doctor who was gentle, kind and informative. At no time did she judge me for what had taken place, but she did question the doctor who had plied me with pills, many of which I didn’t need. So, sobriety support is about love, self- esteem, compassion and kindness.
CATS: WORTHINESS / help,COMMUNITY / healthy relationships,VULNERABILITY / to support my sobriety
WELLGOS: Metta Motivator,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Share & support,RELATIONSHIPS / Build connections & community,VULNERABILITY / support from others

RAW: In my experience, the first anchor for abstinence is myself. Others will find it in various places such as AA, NA, or other support groups. These are all anchors that work. A friend of mine found her abstinence anchor in AA and it has remained so for over 20 years. I have found mine in Alternative Medicine. I turned to Homeopathic Medicine, Massage Therapy, and Herbal Medicine to help me recover and gain my health back. The Homeopathic doctor I worked with 16 years ago helped me to get off pills and cope without them, and I have never gone back.
CATS: FREEDOM / peace & harmony,GROWTH / supporting myself,ABSTINENCE
WELLGOS: New Pattern Painter,Abstainer Amazer,Favorade,Soul-itude ,Inner Winner,WAIT AND SWITCH / Progress

RAW: I clearly recall the first time someone stared me in the face and told me I was using too much of my medication. For me, the need to use the pills over-rode everything else. I needed them, therefore I was going to use them. But, a bold pharmacist stared me in the face and said I was “over-using”. My face flushed red, and my legs wobbled. I didn’t want to hear those words. I only wanted the pills, and felt furious with him for trying to shame me into stop using. Deep down a small part of me knew he was right, and it was that voice which finally helped me to face the truth.
CATS: CONFESSION / denial,INNER POWER / Fears & Strength,COURAGE,TRUTH / dark past
WELLGOS: Bitter Truth Taster,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Face truths,SELF HARM / Self honesty & admit,Demon Greeter,Bitter Quitter

RAW: I am an explorer by nature, and alternatives have always been there for me. I turned to Alternative Medicine 16 years ago, and worked with a Homeopath, an Herbalist, and a Massage Therapist to help me move forward with my life. I also returned to a great love in my life – music. A friend took me to a choir audition and I found great joy and friendship there with fellow women singers. Music and natural medicine served to bring natural alternatives into my life.
CATS: GROWTH / motivation & boosts,GRATITUDE / progress & growth,PROGRESS / start small,GROWTH / successes
WELLGOS: NEW LIFE / POSSIBILITIES,New Pattern Painter,Progress Painter,Symbolic Stepper,Motivation Moonbeamer

RAW: One of the challenges for those of us who fall into or cope with addiction is making amends to people we have hurt along the way. While this did not occur so much for me, I did have to make amends with a doctor who over-prescribed medications to me. After my recovery, I found I still had some anger over what I felt she had done to me, and I approached her with this. Sadly, she wasn’t open to hearing what I had to say and we parted on poor terms. But, I know instinctively that trying to make amends is a positive approach in the journey towards long- term sobriety.
CATS: RECONCILIATON,ACCOUNTABILITY / Amends,CONFESSION / apology & forgiveness
WELLGOS: The First Amender,Relationship Dedamager,Forgiveness Flooder,Responsibility 101’r,Metta Motivator,ADMIT / healing

RAW: One of my greatest bad habits is my tendency to panic in a difficult situation. I learned this young. I saw it at home and assumed it was a natural way to react to situations when in fact, it’s highly dysfunctional. Still, it took years for me to get the panic under control. One of the best bad habit busters I know is to take stock of ourselves. This requires meditation and self- reflection over a period of time, until we’re able to come face to face with the things we do that harm ourselves. And we all do, so there is no need to judge ourselves. I have accepted the fact of my bad habits and I consider it part of my life’s journey to work on them, and not run away from them. Each year as a Jew I have an opportunity on the High Holy Days to take stock of my bad habits and try to be honest about how to work in a positive way to let go of them. Prayer, meditation and self-reflection are healthy ways to acknowledge and work on our habits as is counselling and therapy.
CATS: INNER / SELF / Inventory,INNER MASTERY / beliefs & awareness,GROWTH / behavior & habits,CONFIDENCE / acceptance & worth
WELLGOS: Bad Habit Butcher,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Inventory,Manic Massager,Self Awareness Awakener

RAW: To refuse bad news is one of the ways those of us who cope with addiction have of not facing the world as it is. Instead, sometimes we try to only see the world as we wish it could be. That is entirely understandable, but it also doesn’t work. Bad news is just as much a part of our lives as is good news. My strategy for coping with bad news is to reach out to my support team. If I have a doctor’s appointment I’m worried about, I bring a friend with me. If I have a financial issue I’m worried about, I talk to someone. Instead of stewing in anger and frustration, take bad news by the horns, look at it straight in the face and defuse it. Then, it loses all power over us.
CATS: MINDSET / obstacles & challenge,INNER POWER / Tools,COMMUNITY / ask for assistance,VULNERABILITY / others who’ve been there
WELLGOS: Problem Doctor,VULNERABILITY / share challenges,NEW PATTERN PAINTER / support groups

RAW: Is life a battlefield? Well, yes sometimes it is. For me, the trick is to plan ahead. One of the issues many people who cope with addiction have is the inability or discomfort with surprises and spontaneity. It’s very easy to get nervous or anxious and then panic (which I do) and then sobriety goes out the window. For example, if a big event is coming up and there will be alcohol, then one of the strategies is to ensure that non-alcoholic beverages are also available. For me, it’s more when life presented me with health challenges, I turned to multiple forms of medications and treatments instead of sitting down and thinking it through. Now, I do. I talk to my different practitioners and try to find a natural alternative first before anything else.
CATS: CONFIDENCE /  obstacles & challenge,FREEDOM / tools & strategies,TRIGGERS / tools & techniques
WELLGOS: Reactions Auditor,Dire Extinguisher,Manic Massager,Crisis Cracker,Challenge Ninja,The Blocksmither

RAW: One of the ways addiction is reinforced in our lives is to hang around with people who reinforce our behavior. They might say it’s natural to want to drink when we’re angry, or take pills to make ourselves feel better. This type of behavior reinforcements hurts us, but it can work both ways. After recovery, one needs to find people who reinforce positive behavioral patterns, people who live healthy lives. This also means that sometimes we have to let go of toxic people in our life, and that can be a difficult thing to do.
CATS: INFLUENCES,INNER / SELF / balance,COMMUNITY / healthy relationships
WELLGOS: Bad Influence Bulldozer,Foul Weather Friender,RELATIONSHIPS / Build connections & community,RELATIONSHIPS / Healthy & supportive

RAW: When we live inside an addiction, we tell ourselves a lot of lies. Recovery would be boring. Abstinence is boring. I can’t live without my drugs, my alcohol, or my pills. I need them to survive. I’ve tried rehab and it didn’t work; relapsers can’t recover. These are all lies. But, inside an addiction, it’s easy to believe. Once in recovery we can begin to dispute them. For me, I fully believed that one of the most powerful drugs I took was necessary to my survival. I couldn’t live without it; my life would fall apart. Well, it didn’t, and I’m better for letting go of them. Use this strategy: what beliefs are holding you back? When did you first begin to believe these ideas and why don’t you want to let go of them?
CATS: CONFESSION / denial,TRUTH / Inventory,INNER / SELF / beliefs & insight,CHANGE / beliefs
WELLGOS: Belief Superseder,I-Examiner,ADMIT / Decisions & beliefs,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Inventory

RAW: It’s always someone else’s problem isn’t it? It’s always someone else’s fault? Perhaps someone else has been at fault. In my case, I blamed the doctor. But, when I finally stood up for myself, I realized that I had enabled the situation as much as they did. Then, when I shifted the blame and took responsibility, I was able to take action. I knew what I had to do. This is very much about taking responsibility. So, we need to ask ourselves: what are we not taking responsibility for, and how can we shift that situation to move forward?
CATS: ACCOUNTABILITY / Own up,RESPONSIBILITY,CONFESSION / admit
WELLGOS: Responsibility Baby Stepper,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Face truths,Blame Changer,ADMIT / accountability

RAW: In the recovery journey and afterwards, as we move forward in life, our brains often need a reboot. This implies that our ways of thinking need to change. For people who live inside addiction, the brain becomes fuzzy and unclear. Our thinking is focused only on getting that next drink, that hit, or those pills. The brain needs to reboot and begin thinking in entirely different and new ways. The way to do this, is to sit down and take stock of how your thinking went awry. What kinds of ideas and beliefs took over to support your addiction, and what new ideas and beliefs need to be created?
CATS: INNER / SELF / Inventory,INNER MASTERY / beliefs & awareness,MINDSET / Perceptions,CHANGE / beliefs
WELLGOS: Mentality Mender,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Inventory,ADMIT / Decisions & beliefs,I-Examiner,Self awareness / confidence to admit

RAW: Recovery is a continuum. It doesn’t happen in 30 days or even 90 days. It happens over a long period of time. For me, my initial recovery was 6 months, but then it required several years to truly get well again. Long-term recovery is about moments in time – the moments we create for ourselves and building bridges – new bridges to help us move forward in the journey. It is also about being open to taking that journey, and that can be the most frightening part. Are you ready to walk over a new bridge and move along the cobblestones that you fashion for yourself? Building bridges means building a new, healthy and clean life.
CATS: PROGRESS / start small,WORTHINESS / new life & future,BABY STEPS / first steps
WELLGOS: NEW LIFE / POSSIBILITIES,The Momentumizer ,Progress Painter,New Pattern Painter / confidence & awareness,Baby Step Embracer,WAIT AND SWITCH / Progress

RAW: One of the saddest parts of addiction is that so many of us burn bridges during the process. There are marriages that crumble, children who get abandoned, colleagues and friendships are turned aside. The addiction is so powerful that it becomes the all-important aspect of our life. We don’t want anyone to tell us any different. Sometimes, even in recovery when people try to make amends some people don’t want to hear it. There has been too much damage. It will happen but don’t let this break you. Use it as a starting point to move forward and make new friends and colleagues.
CATS: CONFESSION / damage & hurt,DENIAL,ACCOUNTABILITY / Amends,TRUTH / Costs
WELLGOS: Damage Doctor,Relationship Dedamager,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Face truths,Double Wronger,ADMIT / healing

RAW: Of primary importance in the journey towards recovery is the notion of friendship. People need people. That’s a fact of life. We need others in our lives, people who will be there for us. The journey to recovery is a long one, and there will be a need to get a boost from time to time. Make friends with others who have also been through this journey; they can help you to understand and process what you’re going through. It’s also important that the people who are still in your life understand your journey. But, when this becomes too stressful for them, this is when you turn to a friend who can give you the boost you need to stay on the path of recovery.
CATS: VULNERABILITY / Connection,GROWTH / motivation & boosts,COMMUNITY / healthy relationships
WELLGOS: RELATIONSHIPS / Build connections & community,Worthy Soul’r,Metta Motivator,VULNERABILITY / connections

RAW: Now, that you believe in change, you have to embrace it? This means taking risks. This means being patient. This means looking at yourself in the mirror each day and giving yourself a broad smile and taking deep breaths, and then moving forward. To embrace change implies that you are willing to look at yourself honestly and work on those aspects of yourself that supported your decline. Were there old beliefs at work? Were there toxic relationships involved. Change also means making hard decisions and not returning to old habits and old, dysfunctional relationships and situations.
CATS: WORTHINESS / new life & future,CHANGE / self love & true self,INNER POWER / Decisions,INNER / SELF / patterns
WELLGOS: ADMIT / Decisions & beliefs,Self Worth Surfer,Inner Light Illuminator

RAW: Many people who cope with addictions have poor compulsion control. They may engage in compulsive behaviors such as lying, cheating, etc. Ask yourself some of these questions – are you denying there is a problem? Do you withdraw from activities in order to engage in your ‘habit’? Addictions and compulsions are related to other issues and often these are mental health issues. For me, it was depression that was poorly treated. I also wouldn’t admit I was depressed and kept taking things to try and prove I wasn’t depressed. But, when it hit me that I had declined so far, I knew I had to change. For me, therapy proved to be a life-saver. I learned that there were compulsions I had to control such as the tendency to panic. This was the root of many of my problems which I worked to get under control.
CATS: URGES / tools & techniques,GROWTH / willing to change,INNER MASTERY / self control,CONFESSION / admit
WELLGOS: Denial Denyer,Compulsion KO’r,Soul Controller,Self Control 101'r,Depression Decrypter

RAW: Another very strong issue for people who cope with addiction is avoiding conflict. This was a big issue for me. I couldn’t confront anyone, and I avoided conflict like the Black Plague. I learned that one young as well. Still, I’m an adult and I didn’t want to confront anyone, or have conflicts with others. I had a tremendous need to be liked by everyone. I acted out of desperation and loneliness. But, avoiding conflict only made things worse. Conflict is something we need to face head on, but in a positive way. There are wonderful strategies for how to address conflict in our personal and professional lives. When we do, it’s another way of living a healthy life.
CATS: CONFLICT,RESILIENCE / reaction & behavior,CONFIDENCE /  obstacles & challenge
WELLGOS: Conflict Connoisseur,Quarrel Quasher,Attitude Alchemizer,Placid Reflux,Challenge Ninja,Danger Ranger

RAW: Each and every person in the world is triggered by something. Some of us have multiple triggers. In coping with addiction, its’ absolutely imperative to identify your triggers. It is these conflict triggers that can cause relapses. Once you identify your conflict triggers, then you can begin to work on them one by one. Don’t try to deal with everything at once as that will only overwhelm you. My main conflict trigger has always been about money. Issues related to money can trigger me very quickly and conflicts over money can cause me to panic. So, my strategy is to try to be up front and identify a potential conflict and deal with it before-hand. In this way the issue doesn’t become a conflict.
CATS: RECONCILIATON,CONFLICT,TRIGGERS / tools & techniques
WELLGOS: Conflict Evictor,Triggers 101'r,Behavior Savior,Reactions Auditor,Self awareness / confidence to admit,Qualm Quitter

RAW: I am not the type of person who embraces change. Change brings out my character defects, I resist change at all costs. The changes required for my recovery were not easily made, but they were worth the effort. To expect to be able to do a 360% turnaround on day one felt insurmountable. Many people in the rooms told me not to worry about doing everything at once, but to embrace change one day at a time. This was pivotal for me, I now understood that it wasn’t going to happen overnight, it would take time and require hard work. I didn’t have to try to change all my behaviors at once, but could embrace the baby steps. The one day at a time concept was an aha moment for me. I don’t have to worry about abstaining from all of my binge foods forever, just one day at a time. In terms of my emotional changes, I could use the same approach, work on one character defect at a time, one day at a time.
CATS: PROGRESS / start small,CHANGE / motivations,BABY STEPS / slow changes
WELLGOS: Symbolic Stepper,Baby Step Embracer,Progress Painter,The Momentumizer ,Sobriety 101'r,WAIT AND SWITCH / Small steps

RAW: My programs teach me to step away from confrontational situations, detach with love. The other day, I was preparing to go to a funeral and my husband and daughter were having a heated argument. It upset me to hear them yelling, but I let them work it out and in the meantime, I did the next right thing. I had my breakfast and read a mediation book while they were arguing upstairs. That for me is recovery, I did not step in and try to shield my daughter from her father’s anger. I let them work it out amongst themselves. Trying to save my loved ones from their own pain will only inhibit their growth and cause me pain. I strive to live and let live one day at a time.
CATS: MINDSET / Clear headed,RESILIENCE / reaction & behavior,GROWTH / supporting myself,BABY STEPS / slow changes
WELLGOS: Situation Detacher,Quarrel Quasher,Crisis Cracker,Block Climber,Placid Reflux,Frenzy Freezer

RAW: I can’t get better if I simply look at the outsides, recovery requires that I dig deep (often times, to the places that I don’t want to go).
