RAW: Denial means Don’t Even Know I Am Lying. I am often dishonest with myself about my relapse or slips. I often don’t want to accept bad news. When my father was dying, I regretfully turned to food. When he was on hospice, I was in charge of going to the pharmacy to get morphine for him and remember buying candy. Wasn’t I entitled since my dad was dying? By using food, I was refusing to deal with and walk through the pain of the loss of my father. Acceptance and recovery are the key to all of my problems today, not denial and relapse.
CATS: CONFESSION / denial,VULNERABILITY / learning and mistakes,WARNINGS / Relapse & tools,TRUTH / self honesty
WELLGOS: Denial Denyer,SELF HARM / Self honesty & admit,ADMIT / honesty,Just One Justifier,VULNERABILITY / admit

RAW: If you were an alcoholic, would you head straight for a crazy bar every Friday night? As a food addict, keeping a healthy distance from unhealthy food settings is necessary. An alcoholic wouldn’t necessarily hang out at a Mummers Parade on New Year’s Day where he knows that there will be massive amounts of alcohol and thousands of people partying in the streets. In the same way, I can’t plan to go to a cookie exchange. Some people can do these types of things, but my disease has progressed to the point that I cannot put myself in such a trigger-laden setting. If I don’t have a plan, I plan to fail. I am fooling myself if I think I
CATS: MINDSET / will power,TRIGGERS / tools & techniques,INNER MASTERY / tools & processes
WELLGOS: Trigger X’r,Self Control 101'r,Self awareness / habits & behavior,SELF HARM ALARMER / remove from situations

RAW: Carving out changes sometimes feels daunting. Do I always want to make difficult changes that are necessary to get better, no I don’t. It’s the difficult changes that I make, sometimes kicking and screaming that are the most valuable. It shows me that God is truly working in my life. Change is always possible as long as I believe that recovery is a process and that God has my back. Just giving up my trigger foods was one of the hardest things that I have done. I’ve heard it said that everything I ever gave up had claw marks all over it. This is so true in my case. If God can remove my obsession for my binge foods – he can do anything!
CATS: FREEDOM / future & growth,HIGHER POWER / confidence,CHANGE / courage
WELLGOS: Faith Flooder,Thy Will Be Doner,Almighty Alchemizer,Cosmic Ray Receiver,Miracle Embracer,Divine Designer

RAW: Food addiction can be a means to an end. Although, it results in a slow death, abusing food in unhealthy ways can truly kill us one day at a time. Seeing people who are over 600 pounds and literally eating themselves to death and who can’t get out of bed is eye opening. But, what truly is the difference between someone who is 200+ and 600? Both practice similar unhealthy behaviors, it’s just that the extremely obese person gets my attention. Both are killing themselves with food.
CATS: CHANGE / motivations,AGONY,ABSTINENCE,SOBRIETY / costs & benefits,TRUTH / Costs
WELLGOS: Killer Kickstarter,Grave Trigger,Addiction AMF’r,Torment Terminator,Demon Dethroner

RAW: To get out of relapse, I dig deep to connect with a power that has been dulled by excess food. To work the steps and truly change my addictive behaviors requires a similar approach. If I gloss over surface stuff and don’t dig deep to pull out my emotional baggage, I am bound to relapse. Is it difficult to stir up so much emotionally? Yes, it is. But, if I don’t do the work thoroughly I will not get better. If I do what I always did I will get what I always got. God can help me to be fearless in my work so that I can get to the root of the problems that have lead me to compulsive overeating.
CATS: TRUTH / Inventory,CONFESSION / admit,INNER POWER / Vulnerability
WELLGOS: Inner Soul X-Rayer,Deep Down Diver,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Face truths,VULNERABILITY / Radical self honesty,RAW SOUL REVEALER / costs

RAW: In relapse and before recovery, all of my passion and dreams were put on hold. I barely had the energy to get out of bed in the morning, shower and go to work and school. I feel that God makes dreams possible when I reach out to him in my struggles. He has recently opened up a new way for me to share my recovery in my writing and I feel truly blessed. I am the vessel, he is giving me the words to share. I am amazed at how my unrealized dreams and desires are being fulfilled.
CATS: GRATITUDE / progress & growth,PROGRESS / future & hope,FREEDOM / future & growth,GOD / reach out
WELLGOS: Miracle Embracer,Cosmic Ray Receiver,Blessings Bather,God Grounder

RAW: Food gives me ease and comfort. When I abuse food, I am trying to get away from feeling restless, irritable and discontented. If I don’t change me thinking and my attitudes, I will eventually seek ease and comfort again when I am having difficulties and will turn to food. This is why they suggest in OA and AA that I do not delay working the steps. In OA, if I am following a food plan and not working the steps to change my emotional and spiritual life then I am following a gloried diet and will eventually relapse when challenged. Excess foods and trigger foods help me to tolerate emotional discomfort. The other alternative is to use my recovery, work the steps in order to ease my discomfort and realize a fuller living experience.
CATS: INNER POWER / Self control & willpower,RESILIENCE / reaction & behavior,MINDSET / tolerate discomfort
WELLGOS: WAIT AND SWITCH / Emotions,Sobriety SOB’r,Temperance Tester,Ill Feelings Illuminator,Trigger Transformer

RAW: Did my disease take me to the edge? Yes, it did. I can allow my disease to take me to the edge with excess weight and an out of control life or I can get recovered, lose weight and realize my true potential. I came into the rooms before my son was born, he’s 18 now and when I look at pictures, I can see the pain in my eyes. I looked so much older than my years, even though I wasn’t that old. I would much rather test the limits of my potential through recovery than test the limits of my devastation through relapse.
CATS: CHANGE / courage,SOBRIETY / costs & benefits,MOTIVATION
WELLGOS: Torment Terminator,Addiction AMF’r,Killer Kickstarter,I-Can-ographer,Braverade

RAW: Before recovery, I regulated my emotions by acting out or using unhealthy foods. Today, I do the work required to keep my emotions in check. When I am feeling discomfort emotionally, I make a phone call, work the steps and usually the feelings fade. Sometimes I have a problem that has my full focus and seems so bad that I can’t go on and I work it through the steps and if you asked me in a week what the problem was, I might not remember. It works if you work it.
CATS: EMOTIONS,TRIGGERS / tools & techniques,PROGRESS / reactions & behavior,MINDSET / tolerate discomfort
WELLGOS: Emotions Engineer,Inner I-Opener,WAIT AND SWITCH / Emotions,Ill Feelings Illuminator

RAW: My moods can change from one minute to the next. One sponsor once suggested to me, if you have an unusually stressful morning and it is time for lunch, don’t eat right then, it is not safe. I always thought it was important to be structured to some degree with my mealtimes, but in this instance, this advice was helpful for me. Do I eat when my emotions are not in a good place? Will I make good choices, eat what I planned and not run out to get something else to feed my emotions? This one piece of advice was very helpful and has helped me to stay abstinent on a number of occasions.
CATS: URGES / moods & emotions,PROGRESS / reactions & behavior,VULNERABILITY / to support my sobriety
WELLGOS: Feelings Flipper,Ill Feelings Illuminator,Behavior Savior,VULNERABILITY / listen to others,SELF HARM / Tools

RAW: Every long and meaningful journey begins with the first step. With food addiction as with any other addiction it is critical to take Step One – admit that I am powerless over food and that my life has become unmanageable. It says I am powerless over FOOD. It also says that my LIFE has become unmanageable. It’s important to connect the two. Which came first, the chicken or the egg? Did my life become unmanageable and I turned to the food or did I turn to the food and then my life became unmanageable? Either way, the physical addiction and the emotional upheaval in my life are tied together. They go hand-in-hand. When I get out of denial, admit my two fold problem, I can begin to put down the food and come to know a better way to live.
CATS: TRUTH / Admit addiction,CONFESSION / powerlessness,CONFESSION / admit
WELLGOS: CLOSET CONFESSOR / Admit addiction,SELF HARM / Self honesty & admit,Powerholic Healer,Bitter Truth Taster

RAW: How I look and act is an indicator for where I am in my program. In recovery, I dress well, take care of myself, eat properly, take care of my emotional health and live a positive life. In my disease, I don’t take care of myself, I don’t dress well, and I neglect my emotional health and live a negative life. My recovery behaviors will lead to me being happier and more fulfilled. The other behaviors not centered on my recovery, will make me more and more depressed. The difference between the recovered me and the addict is almost like a split personality disorder. I am a different person when I am in recovery.
CATS: WORTHINESS / self love & acceptance,GROWTH / behavior & habits,CHANGE / mental confidence
WELLGOS: WAIT AND SWITCH / Progress,Ever Evolving Flower,Progress Painter,I-Opener

RAW: Some people are reactors. For every action there is a reaction. My lack of impulse control caused me problems with the food, but also with my mouth. Jumping the gun and reacting to emotions out of fear does not usually work well for me. If I feel driven to act, it is often my will and not God’s. When I am at peace with a decision, then I know it is God’s will. God will show me over and over again by little signs that I am doing his will. Today, I will practice impulse control with God’s help.
CATS: REACTIONS,GOD / thy will,VULNERABILITY / learning and mistakes
WELLGOS: I-examiner - reactions & behavior,God Grounder,Thy Will Be Doner,Almighty Alchemizer

RAW: My lack of impulse control when it comes to food has not served me well. As my disease has progressed it’s gotten worse. Here is what I know: I don’t like to watch baking shows, it’s a trigger for me. Free food samples sometimes trip me up, because I am a cheap, food addict and can’t resist free stuff. Looking at certain candy packages can trigger my disease. Candy is my drug of choice. Do I feed into every impulse, do I have to react to the temptations? No. The further away I am from addictive substances, the easier it is to abstain from them. I must be vigilant, though, because I never know when something will trigger an impulse response, and I can’t afford to go there.
CATS: WARNINGS / Avoid triggers,SOBRIETY / maintaining & will power,TRIGGERS / tools & techniques
WELLGOS: Void Avoider,Pain Abstainer,Inner Guru Guarder,SELF HARM ALARMER / avoid triggers

RAW: Having items on hand that are alternative choices really helps me to beat the impulse game. I often make a sugar free apple crisp for a party so when everyone is having desserts, I am not triggered. Another way I protect myself is not to make desserts myself, I ask others to do that. Another thing that I do is only keep healthy desserts as leftovers, everything else goes out the door. These safeguards for me are like an Impulse Intervention, they keep me safe from relapse behaviors.
CATS: TRIGGERS / awareness,GROWTH / behavior & habits,CHANGE / action & behavior
WELLGOS: SELF HARM / Tools,New Pattern Painter,Self awareness / habits & behavior,VULNERABILITY / share challenges

RAW: When it comes to food, I am often irrational. My disease tells me that I can have foods that are harmful to me and that they won’t lead to relapse. Even though I know in my heart that one bite will lead to another debacle, my disease tells me that it’s ok just this once. During those moments, I am experiencing a mental blank spot that is part of m addicts mind. I will often conveniently forget the pain of my last binge. Falling into the depths of despair as a result of a relapse is no longer at the forefront of my mind, when my disease takes hold.
CATS: WARNINGS / Relapse & tools,SABOTAGE,CONFESSION / denial,POWERLESSNESS
WELLGOS: Just One Justifier,Sabotage SOS’r,Gremlin Greeter,Torment Terminator,SELF HARM / Warnings

RAW: It is not just important for me to work the food, it is equally important to work an emotional recovery program and maintain a spiritual connection. For me, dieting did not work, because I was only focused on a restrictive eating plan. I never addressed the character defects and stress that kept me going back to unhealthy eating and bingeing. The risk of relapse is lessened only by my realization that it is necessary to do all the parts of my program if I want to continue to recover. It is almost guaranteed that if I focus on one leg of the three legged stood – the physical, I will eventually fall down. The other two parts of the stool – emotional and spiritual are what will keep me grounded so that excess food is no longer necessary.
CATS: HEALING,GROWTH / true self,INNER / SELF / awareness
WELLGOS: Lapse Lessenizer,Spiritual Conquest-ador,Whole Soul Healer,Divine Designer,Healing #2

RAW: A lapse in my program is an opportunity for me to learn from my mistakes and hopefully not continue to repeat the same ones over and over again. Recently, I came to the realization that by going to a certain friend’s home where there was excess food and alcohol, that I was setting myself up to binge. I don’t drink and have issues with my husband’s alcohol use. Invariably, he not only drinks, he does shots all night and gets out of control. By the end of the night, I justify eating sugar because he made me so upset. A recovery friend suggested that I was using his disease as an excuse to pick up. What would be the difference if I started drinking again, or used heroin. Addiction is addiction. The lesson I learned is this: there are people, places, and things that I have to avoid to protect my recovery. From now on, I meet with this friend at recovery meetings or for a healthy lunch, but I will not go to a party at her home where the intention is drinking, because it’s a trigger for me.
CATS: WARNINGS / Avoid triggers,LAPSE,INFLUENCES,INNER POWER / Tools
WELLGOS: Lapse Lessonizer,VULNERABILITY / mistakes & learning,SELF HARM ALARMER / avoid triggers

RAW: There are steps that I can take in my recovery that will help to prevent relapse. Things like focusing on recovery behaviors: following a food plan, being prepared with my food, reading meditation books in the morning and night, exercising regularly, doing my step work and going to recovery meetings. Will all of these things keep me from relapsing – not necessarily. Will they aid in my recovery and help to prevent me from relapsing – yes, they will. As I have grown in the program, my list of recovery behaviors has grown. At one point, I didn’t do meditation readings in the morning and night. One time, I told my sponsor that I felt good in meetings, but felt like I didn’t really work a program when I wasn’t at a meeting. She suggested incorporating daily reading and focusing on my spirituality and that has helped me to grow in my recovery. I am following Good Orderly Direction (GOD).
CATS: SOBRIETY / maintaining & will power,GROWTH / supporting myself,BABY STEPS / slow changes
WELLGOS: Self Control 101'r,New Pattern Painter,Sobriety 101'r,WAIT AND SWITCH / Progress

RAW: I am more than a lazy thinker when I succumb to unhealthy eating and fall head-first into relapse. I am lazy in all aspects of my life. All I want to do is pull the covers over my head and give up on life. I binge watch TV while eating binge foods. I hop from one unhealthy food to the next, never being satiated. I am lazy in my dealings with my kids, I don’t want to do anything for them to help them. When I am bingeing, I don’t want to cook meals for my family, I am constantly full and uncomfortable. I am lazy in my relationship with my husband. I don’t want to work on my relationship, I’d rather be left alone. In relapse, I am more than a lazy thinker, I am downright LAZY. That is not who I want to be. In recovery, I cook healthy meals for my family, I watch less TV, I don’t pull the covers over my head – I am positive about my life, I focus on ways that I can help my kids and my husband, and I work on my marriage.
CATS: BINGE,RESPONSIBILITY,CONFESSION / admit,MOODS
WELLGOS: Lazy Zapper,Depression X’r,Self Unscrewer,The Procrastina-shunner

RAW: My moods are level in recovery. When I am feeling unstable, I can work my program with a vengeance and my mood will stay stable. I work the steps to deal with anxiety, fear, anger and resentment. I turn problems over to God. All of these coping mechanisms keep me grounded. When I am in relapse, I experience mood swings. When I am detoxing from sugar, I can get extremely angry disproportunate to the situation.
CATS: ANXIETY,MOODS,OVERWHELM,MINDSET / identify weaknesses
WELLGOS: Frenzy Freezer,Ill Feelings Illuminator,Moody MF’r,Qualm Quitter

RAW: It’s important for me to be mindful of how I am feeling. Am I falling into negative thought patterns? Am I falling back into negative behavior patterns? Am I experiencing issues with my food plan such as: sloppy food plan, bites licks and tastes or relapse behaviors? Am I attending meetings and working a program in between meetings? Have I been reading meditation books in the morning and night and staying connected to God? Usually, the negative thoughts start to pervade my mind when the negative behavior patterns start. They go hand-in-hand. It is important that I monitor my thoughts so that when things start to slip, I can ask God to help me to change so that I don’t fall into relapse behaviors.
CATS: THOUGHTS,INNER MASTERY / beliefs & awareness,WARNINGS / self aware & listen
WELLGOS: Negativity Nuker,THOUGHTS / aware & examine,Inner Soul X-Rayer,The Mindfulizer

RAW: There are certain people in my life that feed negativity that I try to stay away from. Fortunately, I have several people in my family who I can count on to help me to combat my negative thought patterns. They know me well and know when I am struggling and will make suggestions they know will help me to shift my thinking. They may ask how my food is or if I’ve been to a meeting lately. Other people who help me are recovery friends who I feel most comfortable with if I am having any problems with my program. The problem is, when I am in a negative state, don’t like to pick up the phone and ask for help.
CATS: INFLUENCES,BABY STEPS / Help & support,COMMUNITY / ask for assistance
WELLGOS: Bad Influence Butcher,VULNERABILITY / listen to others,RELATIONSHIPS / Healthy & supportive

RAW: Recovery is a constant challenger to previously held beliefs. What I believed I needed was certainly not what I needed. I was eating to feed a hole in my sole that could never be satisfied. The hole in my sole was only filled when I put down the food, worked the steps and cleared my connection to God. The emptiness that I felt wasn’t due to physical hunger, it was due to spiritual hunger. My old belief that certain foods will make me feel better will only keep me sick. My new belief that if I ask God to help me with my urges for certain foods, he will never let me down. Replacing old beliefs with new beliefs is a critical part of the recovery process.
CATS: INNER / SELF / beliefs & insight,GOD / reach out,CHANGE / beliefs
WELLGOS: Belief Superseder,Soul Survivor,Whole Soul Healer,VULNERABILITY / share with god

RAW: There were so many negative patterns of behavior that had to be broken when I came into the OA rooms. I often didn’t eat till noon, one large unhealthy meal. Then I would snack on unhealthy foods throughout the day. At the end of the day, after an unhealthy dinner, I would look for sugary foods to finish off the day to have in the evening. At one point in time, I also used excess alcohol in addition to all the unhealthy foods. One by one, the patterns needed to be arrested if I was to get better. It started with 3 meals a day, nothing in between and a snack at night. Compared to the undisciplined way that I had been eating, this was a huge change.
CATS: CHANGE / action & behavior,PROGRESS / rewards & proud,GROWTH / supporting myself
WELLGOS: Pattern Interrupter,New Pattern Painter,SELF HARM / Tools,Soul Surgeon

RAW: You can’t solve problems if you never admit that you have them. The first step in OA is that I am powerless over food and my life has become unmanageable. Interesting it is not just that I am powerless over food. They purposely connected the two – food addiction and unmanageable life are integral parts to step one. My addiction did help to bring about the unmanageability of my life. That is why diets alone don’t cure true compulsive overeaters. It’s critical that I have a new way of living, of acting on life rather than reacting to it.
CATS: CONFESSION / powerlessness,MINDSET / Future sobriety,CHANGE / action & behavior
WELLGOS: CLOSET CONFESSOR / Admit addiction,VULNERABILITY / admit,Problem SOS’r,Self awareness / habits & behavior

RAW: Before I came to the rooms, although I came from a family with a recovering alcoholic father, a mother who attended Alanon, I denied my problems for a long time. Admitting that I was addicted to alcohol was hard for me. I actually admitted my food problem first and got into recovery for that. Interesting, but my desire to lose weight helped me to quit drinking. Although I liked alcohol and other substances, food was my drug of choice. Gratefully, I felt that food was an acceptable addiction that I could admit to, so my life in recovery could begin.
CATS: TRUTH / Admit addiction,COMMUNITY / Meetings & groups,CONFESSION / admit
WELLGOS: ADMIT / healing,RELATIONSHIPS / Meetings & support,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Admit addiction,RAW SOUL REVEALER / thoughts

RAW: My problems became more manageable in recovery. Before that, everything was always so overwhelming. By sharing my troubles with a sponsor, I learned ways to look at things and handle things in a much healthier way. I became more honest with myself and others about what I was doing. Working my problems through the steps helped to take childhood issues and address them once and for all. To carry those burdens most of my life, was too much. Sharing them with my sponsor helped me to put my problems in perspective.
CATS: OVERWHELM,TRUTH / Admit addiction,VULNERABILITY / Show true self
WELLGOS: Qualm Quitter,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Share & support,Problem Soul-ver,VULNERABILITY / share challenges

RAW: Baby steps are to be celebrated. Each day, I can include new recovery behaviors and make positive changes that can be embraced. I do not have to do my program 100% from day one. I can build on the foundation that was started and incorporate new positive behaviors each day that help me to change and move toward the light of recovery. I celebrate progress not because I have done everything, but because God and my support system have helped me to live differently one day at a time.
CATS: SOBRIETY / celebrate & progress,BABY STEPS / Accomplishments,GROWTH / successes
WELLGOS: Baby Step Embracer,WAIT AND SWITCH / Small steps,The Successcalator,Ever Evolving Flower,Rainbow Hunter

RAW: If I am not prepared, I will not progress. I develop action plans that include all of the things that are required to reach my recovery goals. It’s suggested that I don’t make any major changes right away like getting into relationships or changing jobs, etc. As my recovery foundation is firmly in place, I can begin to address bigger challenges as I have a support system around us and have developed coping skills to solve problems and to make positive changes.
CATS: PROGRESS / start small,GROWTH / behavior & habits,BABY STEPS / Help & support
WELLGOS: WAIT AND SWITCH / Small steps,Progress Pollinator,Self awareness / habits & behavior,NEW PATTERN PAINTER / support groups

RAW: One of the fun aspects of recovery from food addiction is the “pink cloud”. As I begin my recovery path, I can sometimes have euphoric feelings as the addictive substance are no longer triggering me. I feel a slight high and a lot of positive feelings. This is a fun part of the recovery process. Unfortunately, this is not a permanent state. I find that dealing with life on life’s terms starts to interfere with my pink cloud. I have challenges that I am not sure how to handle without using. Before, if I had a bad day or felt stress, I would eat excess food to numb out. Without those foods to go to, the feelings become difficult to handle.
CATS: CONFESSION / powerlessness,WARNINGS / self aware & listen,MINDSET / tolerate discomfort
WELLGOS: Pink Cloud Clinger,Danger Ranger,Problem Primer,I-Examiner,VULNERABILITY / Radical self honesty,SELF HARM / Warnings

RAW: I don’t take my progress for granted. It is important to be grateful for the lessons I am learning in recovery and the progress that I am making. Even small victories are considered progress and are to be celebrated. Going to a party and instead of leaving the food up in the air, eating before I go so I am not tempted. Checking the menu before I go to a restaurant to make sure I can get the appropriate foods and planning my meal ahead of time, this is progress. In my disease, each time I went out it was an excuse to have whatever I wanted and to eat excess foods that were not good for me.
CATS: PROGRESS / rewards & proud,PROGRESS / future & hope,GROWTH / gratitude
WELLGOS: Little Win Welcomer,New Pattern Painter / confidence & awareness,Growth Gardener,Gratitude Baby Stepper

RAW: One of the progress propellers in the program is taking the scary step toward getting a sponsor. Before you reach out for help, you are often in denial that the program will work for you. By getting a sponsor, I admit that I have a problem and commit that I am willing to do whatever it takes to get better. Without getting help, I can hang out on the periphery of the program without ever really admitting my problem or working the program. Hoping I can get better just by going to meetings and soaking it in, is not enough for me.
CATS: TRUTH / Admit addiction,PROGRESS / support ,VULNERABILITY / others who’ve been there
WELLGOS: VULNERABILITY / reach out for help,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Admit addiction,NEW PATTERN PAINTER / support groups

RAW: Recording my progress is a useful tool in the program. Especially when I am dealing with food addiction. Keeping track of the date I came in, how much I weighed. It is even helpful to have a physical exam at the doctors to address any health issues that may have resulted from compulsive overeating. In this way, I can continue to monitor my progress over time. I can also experience progress when I exhibit new behaviors that I never did before. Or, I intuitively know how to handle situations that used to baffle me.
CATS: SOBRIETY / celebrate & progress,GROWTH / behavior & habits,CHANGE / motivations
WELLGOS: Progress Pollinator,I-Examiner,WAIT AND SWITCH / Progress,New Pattern Painter / grit & progress

RAW: Addicts tend to rationalize poor behavior. Well, I was stressed to I ate XXX. Feelings are not supposed to dictate what I am eating. Diet mentality is a definite mind twister for me. For example, I hear about a new diet that has a cheat day where you restrict 6 days a week and on day 7 you can eat whatever you want. I can rationalize that sounds like a good idea. The problem is, I am a compulsive overeater with a binge disorder. A cheat day for me could turn into a cheat year. There is no stopping me once I put certain substances in my body, just like an alcoholic is drawn to alcohol, I am drawn to sugar. Do I wake up in the morning and plan to keep going? Sometimes I do, I get a negative attitude and plan in my head what I want to have before I stop bingeing. The problem is, the more I eat my binge foods, the more I want my binge foods. When I finally get to a day where I have the willingness to try to stop bingeing because I have so much trigger foods in my system, my body continues to crave more unhealthy foods. I can’t even go to a convenience store or grocery store without buying candy or something else that isn’t good for me when I’ve been bingeing ecently.
CATS: EXCUSES,BINGE,WARNINGS / Avoid triggers
WELLGOS: Rationalization Rinser,The Debinger,Sabotage SOS’r,VULNERABILITY / Radical self honesty,SELF HARM ALARMER / avoid triggers

RAW: I often react inappropriately when I am having problems with my food. My anger is way more intense when fueled by the self-loathing I feel when I am in relapse. The people I love deserve better. They deserve to be treated with love and kindness. Lashing out in anger at my loved ones is not how I want to respond to them. If I continue to work my program, I will work the steps to get a handle on how I respond and react to my loved ones. By doing this, we will have a healthier home.
CATS: ANGER,RECONCILIATON,CHANGE / action & behavior
WELLGOS: Relationship Redeemer,Venom Vaporizer,Angerexia,Metta Motivator

RAW: When I came back to the rooms from a relapse. I had a wonderful sponsor who I had worked with for at least ten years when I first got recovered. She said, “What can I do to help you?” I said, “I am willing to have 3 meals a day with nothing in between and a snack at night.” She said OK, I can work with you. If she had said I had to weigh and measure my food and abstain from flour and sugar, I couldn’t have done that. I was too far gone. Eventually, after I’d been doing that for a while, she suggested I weigh and measure my food and plan it each day. Without the willingness to do it differently when I came back, I don’t think I could have gotten better, I needed to take those baby steps.
CATS: PROGRESS / start small,VULNERABILITY / learning and mistakes,BABY STEPS / first steps,COMMUNITY / listen to guidance
WELLGOS: WAIT AND SWITCH / Small steps,Baby Step Embracer,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Share & support,VULNERABILITY / share relapse

RAW: Recovery is a lot of hard work. If someone tells you it’s easy, they are not working a strong program. Is it worth the effort? Absolutely. Focusing on weight loss and changing my eating not temporarily but forever, one day at a time is what is required. That means changing everything about the way that I think about food. I can’t leave my food plan up in the air. I commit to a healthy, structured plan of eating and do the work to follow that plan. Grocery shopping to get the foods that are necessary for my food plan is one of the things that I have to do on a regular basis. Once I get the foods in the house, food prep is an integral part of following a food plan. I tend to cook in batches, so that I am prepared to have my meal plan covered for several days. I will often make a few things at once so planning my food for the week is easier. This week, I made chili, two meat loafs and roasted potatoes and carrots. I can add a salad and I am set for the next few nights for dinner.
CATS: BABY STEPS / Accomplishments,PROGRESS / start small,CHANGE / action & behavior,GROWTH / behavior & habits
WELLGOS: Progress Painter,Sober Selfie,WAIT AND SWITCH / Small steps,The Successcalator,New Pattern Painter / grit & progress,COMMITMENT knitter / celebrate

RAW: Avoiding relapse is not an easy task. Having the same sense of gravity about food that alcoholics have about alcohol and drug addicts have about drugs is really important. If I continue to kid myself that my disease is not that bad, I will continue to relapse over and over again. Being prepared and planning what is necessary to follow my food plan is also really important. If I don’t plan, I plan to fail. My meetings, meditation and step work is also something that cannot be put aside if I am to avoid relapse.
CATS: WARNINGS / Relapse & tools,INNER POWER / Self control & willpower,SOBRIETY / maintaining & will power
WELLGOS: Lapse Lessenizer,VULNERABILITY / Radical self honesty,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Admit addiction,New Pattern Painter,Void Avoider,The Procrastina-shunner

RAW: Relapses are not 100% preventable. Yet, there are several steps that I can take to keep myself from continuing to struggle in my recovery. Working with a sponsor, following a structured food plan (from a nutritionist that understands food addiction), and attending recovery meetings are some of the most important relapse preventors. Other behaviors that reinforce my recovery and that can help to prevent relapse are: walking & yoga, and constant contact with my higher power. I cannot recover in isolation, being surrounded by recovering friends and staying connected to them will also help to prevent relapse.
CATS: RELAPSE,COMMUNITY / connection with others,VULNERABILITY / to support my sobriety
WELLGOS: Lapse Lessenizer,VULNERABILITY / reach out for help,NEW PATTERN PAINTER / share & learn

RAW: It is important for me to exercise restraint when I want to pick up foods that are not good for me. One of the ways that I do this is with God’s help or by making a call to another addict if I am tempted. It is also important that I don’t put myself into unhealthy food settings. Because I am an addict I do not always have the ability to use will power alone to keep away from trigger foods. This is where I need to take action and use the tools so I don’t continue to succumb to my disease.
CATS: MINDSET / will power,GOD / reach out,INNER MASTERY / self control
WELLGOS: Trigger Trespasser,VULNERABILITY / reach out for help,God Grounder,RELATIONSHIPS / Build connections & community,SELF HARM ALARMER / avoid triggers

RAW: IN my addiction, I never really worried about the risks associate with my behavior. As my weight went up, I was more focused on filling the empty void and didn’t worry about the possible repercussions. I drank and ate whatever I wanted, whenever I wanted. As I saw how badly it was affecting all aspects of my life, I joined a diet club to address the eating first. One thing I learned there was how to follow a healthy plan of eating, and weigh and measure my food. What soon happened was that I ended up either restricting in diet mode or bingeing because my body craved more. I did have a net weight loss when I finished, but I knew that my eating behaviors were not normal and that this type of behavior would not work over the long haul. In OA, I learned that severely restricting and binge eating are a form of bulimic behavior. I just purged through dieting.
CATS: SABOTAGE,WARNINGS / Relapse & tools,BINGE
WELLGOS: SELF HARM / Self honesty & admit,Sabotage SOS’r,Gremlin Greeter,The Debinger

RAW: Gratefully, the steps that I took to get better, going to the diet club, quitting drinking and then eventually going to OA changed the course of my life. I have a friend who was my eating buddy, drinking buddy and pot smoking buddy. I am 53 and I attended her funeral a few months ago. She never stopped, never took the first step and died in her disease. The disease of alcoholism and food addiction can kill you at an early age. There is more to life than the pleasure you think you are getting from excess alcohol and food. I used to think that I couldn’t enjoy myself without these substances. I went to my 35th class reunion this weekend and stared at my friend’s picture all night while I visited with my classmates. I didn’t compulsively overeat and I didn’t drink and I had a nice time. My friend was not alive to join the celebration, so sad.
CATS: GRATITUDE / progress & growth,CHANGE / motivations,TRUTH / Costs
WELLGOS: Grief Greeter,Grave Trigger,WAIT AND SWITCH / Small steps,Pain Abstainer

RAW: Do I know everything there is to know about addiction, absolutely not. I’ve heard it said that self-knowledge avails us nothing. I can have all the knowledge in the world about addiction and still suffer in relapse. I do not get to write the rules, God is writing the script and if I stay connected to him, I am able to follow it today. Before recovery, I didn’t follow any rules and didn’t really care about myself. Today, I have some structure to my life and do my best to keep the boundaries in my life that help me to stay clean.
CATS: INNER POWER / Vulnerability,PROGRESS / support ,HIGHER POWER / surrender
WELLGOS: Faith Factory,Thy Will Be Doner,Ego Puffer,Powerholic Healer,Soul Synchronizer

RAW: I am used to saying no thanks to certain foods. The area that requires more work is saying no to my kids when saying yes might hinder their growth. When my son was in high school I spent a lot of time editing his papers. Now, he is in college and requires more help. I should have showed him the tools to help him to get used to editing his own work. If I do the work for them, they don’t learn what they should learn. I often get angry at my daughter because I feel she has no regard for the value of a dollar. If I said no more often and explained why, she would have a better understanding of the importance of not wasting money on everything she thinks she has to have. Situations like these can fester and give me an excuse to overeat. Today, I plan to say no to my kids when no will teach them life’s hard lessons. I also plan to say no to unhealthy eating. I eat to fuel my body, not my emotions.
CATS: MINDSET / will power,WARNINGS / self aware & listen,INNER MASTERY / take a step back
WELLGOS: Responsibility Baby Stepper,Soul Proprietor,COMMITMENT knitter / laziness & effort

RAW: As an addict, I am the queen of self-deception. Even when I was telling myself I was OK, I knew that I wasn’t. I was fortunate to have a father who was in recovery in AA and I knew that there was help if I chose to seek it. Even though I didn’t like to admit it, I knew I was an alcoholic and my life was unmanageable. I also knew I was addicted to food and that my relationship to food was far from normal. Taking step one can lead me out of the darkness and into the light – it’s life changing.
CATS: POWERLESSNESS,CONFESSION / denial,TRUTH / dark past
WELLGOS: Denial Denyer,Inner Light Illuminator,ADMIT / honesty,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Admit addiction

RAW: I used to avoid situations that I couldn’t handle. I still do that. I tend to be a little on the passive aggressive side. I don’t like to rock the boat. Unfortunately, as I was remaining quiet with resentments and anger brewing in my head, I would eat compulsively. I would harbor a “screw it” mentality. I’ll show them how much they hurt me by abusing myself with food. Do I really show someone else by killing myself with food? Or, I could act like a grown up and address my feelings in a mature fashion so that I don’t have to eat over them. Now, that’s a concept.
CATS: WARNINGS / Relapse & tools,CONFLICT,OVERWHELM,URGES / moods & emotions
WELLGOS: Ill Feelings Illuminator,Tender Feelings TBH’r,Situation Unscrewer,Inner Trash Trasher,SELF HARM / Self honesty & admit,Qualm Quitter

RAW: I have had slips in program. I don’t accept slips very well, I feel a lot of shame and beat myself up. I think the main reason I get so upset is because my emotions are fueled by excess sugar which makes me lethargic, angry, and upset. Before my disease progressed to the extent that it has, a slip was a minor issue or mistake with my food plan. As my disease progressed, unfortunately, my slips are binges. I don’t just pick up one thing, I go on a food bender and may not come out of the haze for several weeks.
CATS: BINGE,SHAME,WARNINGS / Relapse & tools,VULNERABILITY / learning and mistakes
WELLGOS: Shamenesia,Inner Forgiverizer,The Debinger,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Admit addiction,SELF HARM / Self honesty & admit,Dead End Deluder,RAW SOUL REVEALER / past mistakes

RAW: As I recover, I learn to be grateful for the small phases of my recovery. Getting from one hour to the next is a huge milestone. Then I try to get from one meal to the next following my plan. Then I work on one day at a time. Eventually, the days turn into weeks and the weeks turn into years. One of the hardest concepts for me to wrestle with in the beginning was that I would no longer be able to eat XXXX forever. One day at a time, I no longer eat XXXX and look what I have gained as a result – my life back. Getting a life is way more important than any single binge food. In the beginning, it doesn’t always feel that way.
CATS: GRATITUDE / progress & growth,PROGRESS / rewards & proud,BABY STEPS / slow changes
WELLGOS: Sober Milestoner,Baby Step Embracer,WAIT AND SWITCH / Small steps

RAW: When I think about the selfie craze, I am so grateful that it happened after I got recovered. I was at a 35th class reunion the other night and no one has embarrassing pictures of me that I wouldn’t want anyone to see. (Except maybe the one with the hat from the photo booth.) I hold my head up high today and am proud of where I came from and where I am headed.
CATS: MINDSET / Future sobriety,GROWTH / proud,FREEDOM / future & growth
WELLGOS: Sober Selfie,Ever Evolving Flower,Inner Winner,Growth Gardener

RAW: I celebrate my sobriety every day that God helps me stay clean. I can celebrate by sharing my recovery with a newcomer. I share with people in my program that are going through a difficult time and members in relapse. The pain that I suffered in my disease and my relapse were not in vain if I can use those experiences to help someone else. I share my recovery when I do service and tell my story at a meeting or submit a writing to the OA newsletter. There are many ways that I can celebrate my sobriety in my program.
CATS: WORTHINESS / connections & sharing,SOBRIETY / celebrate & progress,COMMUNITY / sharing
WELLGOS: Inner Wealth Welcomer,RELATIONSHIPS / Healthy & supportive,The Blessifier,The Benefisher,Metta Motivator

RAW: Taking the first step is a stepping stone to a commitment to do the work required to recover one day at a time. Making a decision isn’t enough, making the commitment to work with a sponsor and take the necessary steps to recover is also critical. Before recovery, I made a decision to start a diet every Monday, but I never did. When I crossed the threshold of my first OA meeting, I was beaten down by my disease. By reaching out to someone who had what I wanted, I began my recovery journey. It all begins with the first step, but it has to be TAKEN.
CATS: COMMITMENTS,BABY STEPS / Help & support,VULNERABILITY / others who’ve been there
WELLGOS: VULNERABILITY / share challenges,COMMITMENT knitter / abstinence confidence,NEW PATTERN PAINTER / motivations

RAW: When I came back to the rooms after my last relapse, I was like a sponge. There was a new approach to OA recovery through the AA Big Book. It was something that resonated with me and I felt hopeful that this approach would help me. I didn’t just go to one meeting a week. I went to one meeting with friends that was 45 minutes away because it was so strong. I listened to meeting recordings on my phone when I walked my dog. I went to local meetings and workshops. I did everything that I possibly could to absorb this new method of recovery. If I was on a particular step, I would search for meetings and writings about that step and immerse myself in the step. This process was extremely helpful to my recovery.
CATS: WARNINGS / Relapse & tools,CHANGE / action & behavior,GROWTH / motivation & boosts,COMMITMENTS,INNER MASTERY / self control
WELLGOS: Addiction AMF’r,The Dynamotivator,Crisis Catapulter,Obstacle Outfoxer,Opportunity Oompher,Adversity Adventurer,COMMITMENT knitter / celebrate

RAW: The serenity and peace that comes from my connection to God and my recovery is priceless. I no longer live in such a negative frame of mind. I feel hope for the future and am not obsessed with my past mistakes. What’s past is in the past and I choose to move forward in my recovery today. I appreciate soothing moments today that escaped me before: in the park, in my garden, at the beach, and with my family. These are the true gifts and miracles of my recovery today.
CATS: FREEDOM / past & let go,CONFIDENCE /  hope & future,GRATITUDE / progress & growth,SERENITY,HIGHER POWER / confidence
WELLGOS: Miracle Embracer,Blessings Bather,Serenity Soulmater,NEW LIFE / POSSIBILITIES,Infinity Infuser,Cosmic Ray Receiver

RAW: I have many friends and family members today who support me in my recovery. They see what a different person I am in recovery and understand how important it is to me. When I first started going to OA, I didn’t even tell my boyfriend (now husband). I used to go to a weight loss meeting on a certain day of the week and I started going to OA on the same night. My sister was also going and she was talking about it with my boyfriend and he had no idea what I was doing. I wasn’t sure if it would work for me, so I was afraid to share it with him. Today, I share my program with people if I feel it may help them in some way, but those closest to me know about my recovery and how important it is in my life.
CATS: WORTHINESS / connections & sharing,GRATITUDE / for others,COMMUNITY / sharing
WELLGOS: RELATIONSHIPS / Trust & vulnerability,VULNERABILITY / support from others,Beloved BFF’r,Gratitude Grower

RAW: I could never have visualized what my life would be like sober. I didn’t even think I could go out and socialize without using before I got recovered. Today, I socialize, I just don’t hang at bars and places that are not healthy for me. I’d rather meet for coffee and to chat than going out to eat all the time. Or, I’ll suggest a safe place I know I can get a good salad rather than trying to find something at another restaurant. Before I couldn’t see myself sober, now I can’t see myself the other way. I can’t imagine going backward in my recovery journey. Today, I move forward in my recovery one day at a time.
CATS: FREEDOM / past & let go,MINDSET / Future sobriety,CONFIDENCE /  hope & future
WELLGOS: Memory Rinser,NEW LIFE / POSSIBILITIES,Soul Survivor,Rainbow Hunter,Inner Sun Shiner,New Pattern Painter

RAW: I didn’t just have a spiritual deficit before recovery. I had NO CONNECTION at all. I had a God I grew up with, but never had daily contact prior to recovery. I placed food, alcohol and drugs before God. When I was juggling that many different substances, I didn’t have too much time to spend on nurturing my prayer life, meditating and developing a relationship with God. Today, I nurture my spiritual connection by reading program literature, reading AM & PM meditations, meditating, and doing yoga. I don’t do all of those things each day, but if I continue to incorporate my spiritual tools into my program, I will come to know and rely upon a power greater than myself.
CATS: SOBRIETY / behavior & action,FREEDOM / peace & harmony,HIGHER POWER / surrender
WELLGOS: Spiritual Conquest-ador,Higher Power Invoker,Soul Synchronizer,New Pattern Painter

RAW: One of the reasons I stayed away from recovery is because of the stigma associated with addiction. I really didn’t want to admit my alcoholism. To me, a recovering alcoholic always had a negative connotation, assuming they would never really get better. For this reason, I am grateful I came into the rooms of OA to get recovered. Working the 12 steps helped me to abstain not only from unhealthy foods, but also alcohol and drugs. Hard core addiction specialists would say I should attend more than one program. Today, I attend OA and Alanon and it works for me. At another phase in my recovery, I attended AA & OA. I like AA meetings, but I identify more as a compulsive overeater.
CATS: COMMUNITY / Meetings & groups,TRUTH / Admit addiction,LABELS / STIGMA
WELLGOS: CLOSET CONFESSOR / Admit addiction,RELATIONSHIPS / Build connections & community,RELATIONSHIPS / Meetings & support,Stigma Stigmatizer

RAW: I don’t really have too many issues concerning monitoring my stress level. I am the type of person that is pretty much what you see is what you get. When I am feeling stressed, as long as I am aware of the stress that I am feeling, I work with another recovering member or sponsor to address it. I can’t afford to push through and ignore it when I am feeling stressed, doing so puts me at risk of picking up excess food or unhealthy foods. I do not eat when I am extremely stressed. A sponsor suggested I process my feelings before eating when I am under a lot of stress. That has been sage advise for me.
CATS: STRESS,REACTIONS,MINDSET / deal with frustration,COMMUNITY / listen to guidance
WELLGOS: Stress Auditor,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Share & support,Placid Reflux,Emotions Engineer,Qualm Quitter

RAW: It is difficult when I feel that a situation that seems harmless begins to stress me out. I am sometimes caught off-guard. I try to identify why I am upset in order to understand what is at the root of my uncomfortable feelings. Working the steps is an excellent tool for me to use when I am having difficulty. It has gotten me out of jams many times in my life.
CATS: STRESS,EMOTIONS,TRIGGERS / awareness,MINDSET / deal with frustration
WELLGOS: The De-stress-calator,Ill Feelings Illuminator,I-examiner - reactions & behavior,Self Awareness Awakener,Deep Down Diver

RAW: My disease tells me that binge foods bring me comfort. Or, that excess food calms me down. The truth of the matter is I find no comfort in my binge foods. Excess food makes me feel shitty. What my disease tells me when I am stressed is to look to food to sooth my stress. What my program teaches me is to look to God, other recovering members and the steps to ease my stress. My program helps me to put my life back in balance. Using excess food or bingeing only turns my life upside down.
CATS: BINGE,DELUSION,INNER / SELF / balance,CONFESSION / damage & hurt
WELLGOS: CLOSET CONFESSOR / Share & support,The Debinger,The De-stress-calator,Placid Reflux,SELF HARM / Self honesty & admit

RAW: Over time, I have identified stress triggers. One of the things that I never really thought about was work stress. If I am feeling stressed on a project, it is often related to my own defects. Today, I understand that I can process my feelings so that I can grow in recovery, rather than give into the stress and pick up unhealthy foods to make me feel better. I can take any problem with work, my food, my relationships, my kids, or my friends to God and run it through the steps. I don’t have to eat over my feelings.
CATS: TRIGGERS / awareness,STRESS,URGES / moods & emotions
WELLGOS: Feelings Flipper,Anxiety X-terminator,Nerve Ninja,Trigger Transformer,SELF HARM / Tools

RAW: Asking for help is very humbling. I was nervous to ask my first sponsor to work with me. I am very blessed that we worked together and spoke almost daily for close to 10 years. As my life got busier, the regular contact became harder and we decided to stop working together. When I came back after a relapse, that same sponsor offered to help me get better. These are the gifts of recovery. People love me unconditionally, not only when I am working my program perfectly, but even when I fall short or relapse. My job as a recovered person is always to extend my hand to those who share my compulsion. As my sponsor shared her program, I share mine... a blessing.
CATS: COMPASSION,WORTHINESS / help,VULNERABILITY / others who’ve been there
WELLGOS: CLOSET CONFESSOR / Share & support,The Blessifier,Metta Motivator,The Empathologist,VULNERABILITY / share relapse

RAW: If you look on the surface, most families look good, they kind of have a Brady Bunch air about them. Lots of happy kids, all cleaned up for the camera. In my family, there was love, but there was also a lot of addiction and dysfunction. My father was a recovered alcoholic, my mother is a member of Alanon and a compulsive overeater in OA, my sister is a food addict and I am a food addict. Beside the addiction, there was some emotional trauma that took place in our home that was difficult to work through in recovery. If you dig a little, everyone has skeletons. It’s what you do with them that matters. My father passed away several years ago, but he was 25 years sober, a respected member of the AA program. My mother has been in Alanon for almost thirty years and works an OA recovery program. I have been in recovery nearly 20 years.
CATS: DEMONS,PAST,CONFESSION / admit,VULNERABILITY / Show true self
WELLGOS: CLOSET CONFESSOR / Face truths,Deep Down Diver,Demon Greeter

RAW: I cannot control my temper if I use sugar. Especially, if I am detoxing. I am like an alcoholic without a drink, restless, irritable and discontented. Do I want to behave that way with my co-workers, friends or family members? Is it ok to be short tempered all the time and go off at the drop of a hat? My temper is tempered by recovery behaviors. The more of them that I do, the more balanced my mood and behaviors. I choose to live a God filled, balanced life today. I no longer want to be triggered to react in anger by the slightest comment
CATS: ANGER,PROGRESS / reactions & behavior,MOODS,INNER / SELF / patterns
WELLGOS: Anger Rinser,Venom Vaporizer,Frenzy Freezer,Moody MF’r,Feelings Flipper,New Pattern Painter

RAW: Recovery really challenged my way of thinking. I am used to fixing things myself. When I was little my favorite thing to say was, “I’ll do it myself”. My mom tells a story about me when I was little, I had a favorite pair of boots and I walked out of the house on a regular basis with them on backwards because I insisted on doing it myself. I can picture that little girl, head strong, believing she was right because she did it herself. Today, I can take a level headed approach to problems and no longer do everything myself. I can rely on my higher power as well as my support system to help me.
CATS: CONTROL,HIGHER POWER / confidence,VULNERABILITY / to support my sobriety
WELLGOS: Higher Power Invoker,VULNERABILITY / reach out for help,Pride Puffer,Control Unfreaker

RAW: When I have food thoughts or dreams, it is often my disease playing itself out in my unconscious. Usually, it is because there is something troubling me that I am not aware of or not addressing. Since my fallback position is to push things under the rug and stuff things down, I try to be mindful when these types of things happen. If I am triggered by certain foods that I have been neutral around, this is also reason to pause and see if something is bothering me.
CATS: CONFESSION / admit,VULNERABILITY / Show true self,DEMONS
WELLGOS: Self Awareness Awakener,Demon Greeter,Deep Down Diver,VULNERABILITY / Radical self honesty

RAW: Changing my thoughts and behavior is not an easy task. It requires making changes to all aspects of my life. Instead of going to the boardwalk to eat a bunch of unhealthy foods, I would go and appreciate the view of the beach. This was a huge shift for me. To be able to appreciate the moments in life that are gifts in and of themselves. Learning that I couldn’t rely on my finite self and that God in his infinite wisdom has a much better plan for me. I learned how not to carry the baggage from my past into today, to let it go.
CATS: FREEDOM / past & let go,FREEDOM / peace & harmony,CHANGE / action & behavior,HIGHER POWER / surrender
WELLGOS: Past #2,Cosmic Ray Receiver,Insight Inseminator,New Pattern Painter / confidence & awareness

RAW: Things shifted when I started to get better. Two of my favorite roles were the victim and the martyr. I always jumped to the negative in a given situation. Self-pity was a way of life for me. I liked to say I dabbled in self-pity. If you had my problems, you’d eat like me, too. I especially liked the dual role of the martyred victim. People were doing things to me and I was above reproach, always right and they were always wrong. These ideas did not serve me well. All of my programs helped me to shift my thinking, but I feel that Alanon helped the most.
CATS: PITY ,CONFESSION / admit,ACCOUNTABILITY / De-blame,CHANGE / thoughts
WELLGOS: THOUGHTS / aware & examine,Victim Vaccinator,Pity Policer,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Share & support,ADMIT / accountability

RAW: Things that stop me dead in my tracks are problems that are making me obsess. I am constantly rehearsing what to say to someone because I am so upset. Often when I feel this way, I may not want any food, but after the situation passes, I have what I call an emotional hangover and could easily turn to food. Sitting down and doing the work to run a problem through the steps and then sharing with another recovered member works to help stop those crazy thoughts dead in their tracks.

WELLGOS: NeuroTuner,THOUGHTS / aware & examine,Jitters Junker,Desperation Disputer,New Pattern Painter

RAW: When I have insane thoughts, they can lead to insane behavior. One thing that I have been taught is that my thoughts don’t have to lead to actions. If I am obsessing about eating a certain food, I can stop that type of thinking dead in its tracks by calling someone who has my disease. If I am feeling resentful or triggered by fear, I can ask God to help me and reach out to someone in recovery to help me process my feelings. Before recovery, I tried to do everything myself and screwed a lot of stuff up. I no longer have to fix everything myself, I can call on my recovery team to help me when life is too much.
CATS: OVERWHELM,COMMUNITY / ask for assistance,VULNERABILITY / others who’ve been there
WELLGOS: Insanity SOS’r,THOUGHTS / aware & examine,VULNERABILITY / share with god,NEW PATTERN PAINTER / support groups

RAW: I know that things are bad if I am going back and forth and having one negative thought after another about a certain situation. Often it is because I am projecting into the future. What if this happens, and what if that happens? If I stay in this moment, I don’t have to make myself crazy. I am constantly working staying focused on today.
CATS: PROGRESS / start small,THOUGHTS,ANXIETY,BABY STEPS / focus on today
WELLGOS: WAIT AND SWITCH / Small steps,Illogical Looper,Frenzy Freezer,The Mindfulizer,THOUGHTS / aware & examine,Anxiety X-terminator

RAW: I can use the steps to process my thinking, to make changes in my thoughts and actions where needed. If it is a big problem, I can develop an action plan with steps to take to resolve the issue. I have a plan for living today, I am no longer a prisoner to my own negative thinking.
CATS: NEGATIVITY,CHANGE / action & behavior,THOUGHTS
WELLGOS: Negativity Ninja,THOUGHTS / aware & examine,I-examiner - reactions & behavior

RAW: As a recovering compulsive overeater in recovery, do I still have urges to eat the wrong things? I do have urges to eat the wrong foods, but the difference today is that they don’t occupy my thoughts all day every day. Removing certain foods from my food plan has eliminated my daily cravings. When I do have occasional cravings, I can address them as they occur and identify what is causing them. Often, it is because something or someone is bothering me.
CATS: URGES / moods & emotions,INNER MASTERY / tools & processes,WARNINGS / Avoid triggers,TRIGGERS / awareness
WELLGOS: Self awareness / confidence to admit,Urge Auditor,I-examiner - reactions & behavior,SELF HARM ALARMER / avoid triggers

RAW: When I am afraid and really in a negative place where I can’t process something that is making me panic, God is always there. I recently had a situation that had me extremely fearful. In this particular situation, I felt the fear so strongly, I had a physical sensation in my body that made me feel chills. This is a scary place to be for an addict, because I know that if I don’t deal with the emotional turmoil, I am at risk of relapse. I asked God for help, took a step towards amends. As it is still giving me pain and fear, I processed it through writing and plan to share with my sponsor. The things that bring me the most pain will take me back to the food if I don’t deal with them.
CATS: GOD / reach out,FEAR
WELLGOS: Panic X’r,Pain Abstainer,Fear Marshall,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Share & support,God Grounder,Panic Mechanic

RAW: When I want to get rid of anxiety, there are a number of things that I can do. I have learned recently that focusing on my program and doing writings about my feelings, help to lessen my anxiety. As an addict, my reactions to normal stress is not quite normal, my emotions tend to escalate and the slightest problem or situation can throw me completely off emotionally. It is not always easy to fully deal with problems that make me anxious. Sometimes, I think I have a problem dealt with and something prompts me to think about it again. I recently had a situation that brought me a lot of pain and anxiety and a part of me is wanting to know more about the situation and ask people to get me information. I know if I focus on the problem, the problem will increase, if I focus on the solution, the solution will increase. Focusing on the problem is just bringing more pain into my life, God does not want me to focus on that situation and bring more pain into my heart. He wants me to let it go and follow his path.
CATS: GOD / thy will,ANXIETY,TRIGGERS / tools & techniques
WELLGOS: Anxiety Exiler,SELF HARM / Tools,Frenzy Freezer,Problem Soul-ver,Soul-ution Finder

RAW: Closet confessions are the type I would prefer to always have. Only telling myself about my transgressions would be nice. My problem is, I have to bring the problems that trouble me the most to God and to another human being. Some things that I have struggled with, I have always known that if I was afraid to share them with another person, I could bring them to a priest so that I could lift them off of my heart. I have a few things that are troubling me today, that I did a 4th step on and will be sharing with my sponsor. I will continue to pray for Good Orderly Direction as it relates to these harms that I have done to others. When my heart is heavy with pain and fear and guilt, I am only setting myself up to compulsively overeat.
CATS: TRUTH / self honesty,CONFESSION / damage & hurt,VULNERABILITY / Show true self
WELLGOS: CLOSET CONFESSOR / Share & support,ADMIT / honesty,VULNERABILITY / support from others,RAW SOUL REVEALER / past mistakes

RAW: Going to meetings, reading recovery literature and staying connected to people in my program are the prescription that I need from the Misery Doctor to heal the pains of my addiction. I am not perfect, some days, these things are not enough. Some days, I’d rather stay stuck and not focus on a more positive approach to my life. I get into a negative place that almost tries to pull me backward. I don’t want to be social, I feel depressed and sad. I spend a lot of time sleeping and never feel rested. It is important for me not to go to that place, I have been there before and it is extremely harmful. Recently, I have found myself feeling pretty depressed, I reached out to a therapist that I used to see and already feel more hopeful. I am human, I will have setbacks, but my setbacks don’t need to take me back to the beginning and end in a binge. If I really stray from my primary focus in my recovery, God will gradually give me my problems back, one by one to show me that there is still work to be done. Pain is not inevitable. The more I work my program and take the prescribed recovery medicine that is being offered to me, the better my life will be and the more hope I will experience in my life of recovery.
CATS: INNER MASTERY / challenge & resilience,GOD / thy will,NEGATIVITY,GROWTH / supporting myself
WELLGOS: Misery Doctor,SELF HARM / Tools,VULNERABILITY / reach out for help,Adversity Avenger,Negativity Negotiator

RAW: I have experienced depression in and out of recovery. Out of recovery, I quit school and saw a doctor and go on medication to deal with my depression. It was intense and painful. As a college student, I was not able to process all the changes that were occurring as well as a lot of the family issues that I grew up with. When I was on my own, I was unable to work them out and sought help. I was able to get the help that I needed, take the necessary medication and get better. I have also suffered depression since I came into recovery. I think because I am dealing with my feelings more and not eating over them, although I still feel somewhat depressed, it is not as severe. The danger for me is to use the depression as an excuse, to feel terminally unique. If you were as depressed as I am, you would eat too. Some of the depression that I have felt in recovery has been more situational. I have seen doctors to help me, when required. In recovery, with no addictive substances to lean on, I am left with processing my feelings to work through my problems. This is a lot healthier that eating, drinking or using drugs to deal with my feelings.
CATS: EMOTIONS,INNER POWER / Vulnerability,AGONY,INNER / SELF / balance
WELLGOS: Depression Debugger,Tender Feelings TBH’r,VULNERABILITY / Radical self honesty,Soul Survivor,RAW SOUL REVEALER / emotions & urges

RAW: Reaching out for people who love and care for me in recovery and outside my program is always something that makes me feel better. For me, it is important to focus on the people in my recovery program who can help me process my part and not just focus on what someone else did to me, which is the natural inclination. God helps to hug me when I am in pain and he has put people in my life that can provide love and support when I am struggling. I try to reach out to God and my support system in those moments to help lessen my pain. They say that God can and will if he is sought. If I don’t let God in to help me, even with human aid and hugs from friends, the pain will not completely go away. I work on seeking God’s help daily with the pain in my life to truly see what he can do in my life. If I seek his help some days and not others, I am not focusing on my true potential.
CATS: GOD / reach out,CONFESSION / powerlessness,VULNERABILITY / to support my sobriety
WELLGOS: Hurt Hugger,God Grounder,Almighty Alchemizer,VULNERABILITY / share with god,NEW PATTERN PAINTER / support groups

RAW: I could blame my bad behavior on other people. I could blame my addiction on my not so perfect past. I could blame career issues on an employer who let me go. I could blame my husband for not being perfect for his workaholism and alcohol issues. Am I so perfect that I have the right to blame everyone around me for my problems? Blaming, like anger and resentment only harms the blamer, not the “blamee”. If I am blaming others, I am not really being honest with myself about my role in a given problem. I love it when a 50 year old person is talking about how much their parents have ruined their lives. Yes, our parents can shape who we are, but as we become adults and are able to make our own choices, our bad decisions and problems are OURS to own. We cannot blame decisions we make as adults on our parents that is not fair to them. If an employer lets you go, use that situation as an opportunity to grow by taking classes to gain more skills or looking into opportunities to do something different. Taking responsibility for our past mistakes is not easy, but it is necessary for positive growth.
CATS: ACCOUNTABILITY / De-blame,RESPONSIBILITY,TRUTH / Inventory,GROWTH / learning & mistakes
WELLGOS: The Deblamer,ADMIT / accountability,Responsibility 101’r,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Inventory,VULNERABILITY / admit

RAW: My disease has progressed to the point where if I have sugar, I will binge. Maybe not in that first bite, but most likely within 24 hours or a binge, I will pick up more sugar. If I have excess sugar, my system starts to crave more and it consumes my thoughts and actions. It becomes difficult to go to the pharmacy or grocery store and not get candy. When I have had a binge, I have to make a conscious effort to debinge by surrounding myself with recovery, going to meetings, and being honest with my sponsor about where I am. Another way that I debinge is by watching people, places and things. I may even stay away from going to certain stores by myself or certain restaurants until my system is healed from the effects of excess sugar. It is important for me to understand the gravity of my addiction and when I have had a problem really focus on getting my life back by focusing on my recovery and protecting myself from the insidious nature of my disease (especially when my addictive substances are still in my system).
CATS: BINGE,INNER MASTERY / challenge & resilience,INNER POWER / Self control & willpower
WELLGOS: The Debinger,Dire Extinguisher,Crisis Catapulter,SELF HARM ALARMER / avoid triggers

RAW: It’s been said to call a spade a spade. Bringing my demons into the light can only lesson their power to dominate my thoughts and my life. It’s like I am two people the recovery angel and the relapsing devil. My addiction is like a demon that rears its ugly head when I least expect it. When I am happy, a thought may cross my mind that I should celebrate with a certain food that isn’t good for me. If I’m sad, I could easily have the same problem. My mind will drift to what would make me feel better and I can’t always shake the thought. I have learned that even though I have these thoughts, I don’t have to act on every one of them. I can reach out to another compulsive overeater when I am having crazy food thoughts or do something else like taking a long walk and listening to an OA meeting on my phone to change my train of thought.
CATS: DEMONS,THOUGHTS,PROGRESS / reactions & behavior,VULNERABILITY / others who’ve been there
WELLGOS: Demon Doctor,THOUGHTS / aware & examine,VULNERABILITY / reach out for help,Illogical Looper,NEW PATTERN PAINTER / share & learn

RAW: When I have food dreams or food thoughts, I don’t have to hide from them, I can greet them and then identify where they are coming from. Sometimes, they are due to stress or fear or other negative feelings that may trigger me to eat. Confronting my demons or unhealthy thoughts lessons their power over me. Sometimes, I don’t always know what is triggering the food thoughts. It may be because I haven’t been to a meeting in a while or because I am nor working a strong program. Sometimes, I’ve eaten something out that had sugar in it and I didn’t realize it. I triggers the phenomenon of craving and can cause food thoughts. Identifying what is triggering my disease prevents me from relapse as long as I face them head on. Ignoring the warning signs like food dreams and food thoughts is only asking for trouble.
CATS: THOUGHTS,TRIGGERS / awareness,DEMONS
WELLGOS: Demon Greeter,THOUGHTS / aware & examine,SELF HARM / Warnings,Trigger SOS’r,I-Examiner

RAW: My character defects can be demons that undermine my recovery. Just this week, I have struggled with feelings like guilt, fear and anger. Holding onto feelings like this for me is not a luxury that I can afford if I want to remain abstinent from my trigger foods. Harboring negative feelings and exhibiting unhealthy behaviors can take me down faster than eating a piece of candy. Holding onto things that really bother me may not make me binge right away, but bingeing will be the only possible outcome if I don’t process these feelings and conquer my demons. Especially, when I have things that I feel are so bad that I can’t share with anyone, I am in a dangerous place. If I feel this way, I need a demon doctor. In recovery, I have learned that I can share the things that really trouble me with God, a sponsor, a therapist or a priest. People who are working recovery programs sometimes call on outside sources to deal with issues and traumas that they cannot share openly.
CATS: DEMONS,URGES / moods & emotions,NEGATIVITY,VULNERABILITY / others who’ve been there
WELLGOS: Demon Doctor,Ill Feelings Illuminator,Negativity Nuker,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Share & support,VULNERABILITY / support from others,RAW SOUL REVEALER / trust others

RAW: During the holidays and different times of the year, there are a lot of things to do that take my attention away from working my program. Focusing on my program needs to be the single most important thing in my life without exception. I need to protect it the same way that a heroin addict protects their recovery. Especially during holidays when unhealthy foods are all over, I need to be vigilant. I can keep from getting distracted from my program by not skipping my meditation readings in the morning and night. I can make sure that if meetings fall on a holiday or a day where meetings aren’t being held that I plan to get to other meetings to make sure I am reinforcing my program during busy times of the year. Focusing on self-care and exercise are also important to keep me centered and focus on my recovery. Regardless of the distractions that I face, recovery must be my #1 priority.
CATS: MINDSET / obstacles & challenge,SOBRIETY / maintaining & will power,INNER MASTERY / self control
WELLGOS: Distract-shunner,SELF HARM / Tools,Motivation Moonbeamer ,Self awareness / habits & behavior,COMMITMENT knitter / above all else

RAW: To keep my ego in check, I have to really dig deep focus on my motives when I am struggling with decisions. It’s not always all about me. It seems like reaching out to others and helping others will deplete me and take too much time. I tend to make excuses about why I don’t have time for other people. What I forget is that I am often renewed and rejuvenated after working with others. Invariably, the things that I need to hear myself, are the things that I am sharing with others. Sharing my program with others helps reinforce the reason that I need to work my own program. If I am slacking, with a sloppy food plan, not going to meetings or not focused on working my program or daily recovery behaviors how can I really help someone else. I can’t give what I don’t’ have myself. I can’t fake it till I make it when it comes to sharing my program.
CATS: GROWTH / motivation & boosts,GIVING / GENEROSITY,COMMUNITY / sharing
WELLGOS: Ego Excuser,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Share & support,RELATIONSHIPS / Meetings & support,VULNERABILITY / give and receive

RAW: If someone would have asked me if I could follow a healthy food plan and stop eating sugar and bingeing, I would have said no, I can’t. Before I quit drinking, I had no idea how I would feel normal without alcohol. Before recovery, I had no idea how to stop eating compulsively, I had no idea where to start. Little did I know that consuming certain substances like flour and sugar were triggering a phenomenon of craving in me that would not go away without abstinence. In the first step, I admit I am powerless over food, that my life has become unmanageable. Putting down the food one day at time and working a program of recovery can arrest my compulsion. I CAN recover, if I take the first step.
CATS: CONFESSION / powerlessness,CONFIDENCE /  hope & future,BABY STEPS / first steps
WELLGOS: Can’t Cutter,Baby Step Embracer,CLOSET CONFESSOR / Admit addiction,ADMIT / healing

RAW: The habits I had in my disease were not good. I abused drugs and alcohol. I compulsively overate every day. I would sleep on the weekends till about 1:00. In recovery, I am like a bad habit butcher. One by one, I have made positive changes in my life. Today, I get up, have a healthy breakfast, go to yoga and then come home and make a healthy brunch for the whole family when I get up. I often look at the days where I have done a handful of things before 10:00 AM and am amazed at how much my life has changed. As I relapsed and had issues due to menopause, I went through a period where I couldn’t get up and stay up in the morning. I would constantly go back to sleep and the more I slept, the more negative I would feel. Recently, I started driving my daughter to school in the morning at 7:30 or so. Now, I try to schedule a few things to do first to wake myself up before I get home so I am not tempted to go back to sleep. Bad habits are hard to break, but small strides are possible.
CATS: PROGRESS / start small,GROWTH / behavior & habits,CHANGE / action & behavior
WELLGOS: Bad Habit Butcher,New Pattern Painter,SELF HARM / Tools,Progress Painter

RAW: One of the gifts of recovery is to wake up in the morning feeling hopeful about the day. When I was in relapse, my first waking thought was about my unhealthy behaviors from the day before. I would think about my regrets that I couldn’t get better. The hope that I feel each day fuels me to stay on the path that I am on so that I can continue to feel so much hope in my life. When the physical and emotional devastation of the disease are staring me in the face each morning, it is nearly impossible to be hopeful. Even in relapse, I would find hope in going to meetings hearing others share who survived relapse and are now in recovery. Find someone who speaks to your heart and ask them how they got recovered or were able to recover from relapse, there you will find Hope and you may be lucky enough to become Hopenotized.
CATS: VULNERABILITY / others who’ve been there,PROGRESS / future & hope,GRATITUDE / opportunities
WELLGOS: The Hopenotizer,NEW LIFE / POSSIBILITIES,VULNERABILITY / listen to others,Rainbow Hunter

RAW: I experience freedom from the bondage of food by identifying my trigger foods. Having neutrality with my binge foods is a feeling of freedom that I never thought I would experience. It is a gift to be able to go to celebrations and not be focused on unhealthy foods, but on the people who are at the celebration.
CATS: SOBRIETY / celebrate & progress,FREEDOM / peace & harmony,TRIGGERS / confidence & strength,INNER / SELF / awareness
WELLGOS: Inner Freedom Forager,Trigger Transformer,COMMITMENT knitter / celebrate,RAW SOUL REVEALER / emotions & urges

RAW: The gifts that have been uncovered for me as I have been recovering for the past two decades are beyond measure. I embrace all the sparks of bliss and inner greatness that God has revealed to me. In my disease, I couldn’t recognize my gifts, even though I had many – they were dormant. They were covered with shame and self-loathing. Today, I take pride in my gifts and can own them and I have a sense of self-esteem. I am worthy of all the assets that God has blessed me with.
CATS: SOBRIETY / celebrate & progress,JOY,GRATITUDE / opportunities
WELLGOS: Inner Greatness Greeter,Worthy Soul’r,Gratitude Flooder,Bliss Kisser

RAW: How do I exercise self-control? First of all, I don’t have will power or self-control when it comes to food, which is one of the myths that will keep me in my disease. I follow a food plan that doesn’t include my trigger foods. Because I do this I don’t have to “white knuckle” abstaining from the foods that are my “alcohol”. The pull those foods has is removed. I had family for a large holiday meal recently and was able to serve deserts and didn’t even feel triggered at all, that is a complete gift. I make sure I don’t spend too much time preparing deserts or buying things that I really want. This holiday, I asked for help cutting and serving, I don’t have to put myself through that. The people that love me respect the fact that cutting and serving deserts is not something that I like to do. By abstaining from my trigger foods, I have been given the gift of self-control. Food is in its proper place, I eat to sustain me rather than to feed my disease.
CATS: INNER POWER / Self control & willpower,COMMUNITY / ask for assistance,PROGRESS / reactions & behavior
WELLGOS: Self Control 101'r,VULNERABILITY / reach out for help,Progress Pollinator,New Pattern Painter / confidence & awareness

RAW: I struggle with moodiness. I try to keep it in check, but sometimes, I can really be nasty. Fortunately, I have two kids that keep me in check. If I am not being patient with people, they will point it out to me. Gratefully, I am open to them pointing this out to me so I work on being more patient with people.
